translations.text: كيست ستمكارتر از آن كه آيات پروردگارش را برايش بخوانند و او اعراض كند و كارهايى را كه از پيش مرتكب شده فراموش كند؟ بر دل ايشان پرده افكنديم تا آيات را درنيابند و گوشهايشان را كر ساختيم كه اگر به راه هدايتشان فراخوانى، هرگز راه نيابند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كيست ظالم‌تر از كسى كه آيات پروردگارش به وى تذكر داده شود و او اعراض كند و آنچه را كه پيش فرستاده از ياد ببرد؟ ما بر دل‌هاى آنان پوشش‌هايى [از قساوت‌] قرار داديم كه آن (قرآن) را نفهمند و در گوش‌هايشان سنگينى نهاديم. و اگر به سوى هدايت دعوتشان كنى، د

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و كيست ستمكارتر از آن كس كه به آيات پروردگارش پند داده شده، و از آن روى برتافته، و دستاورد پيشينه خود را فراموش كرده است؟ ما بر دلهاى آنان پوششهايى قرار داديم تا آن را درنيابند و در گوشهايشان سنگينى [نهاديم‌]. و اگر آنها را به سوى هدايت فراخوانى باز هرگز به راه نخواهند آمد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و کیست ستمکارتر از آن کسی که متذکر آیات خدایش ساختند و بدانها پندش دادند و باز از آنها اعراض کرد و از اعمال زشتی که کرده بود به کلی فراموش کرد و ما (پس از اتمام حجت) بر دلهایشان پرده‌ها (ی جهل و قساوت) انداختیم تا دیگر آیات ما را فهم نکنند، و گوش آنها را (از شنیدن سخن حق) سنگین ساختیم و اگر به هدایتشان بخوانی دیگر ابدا هدایت نخواهند یافت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: چه کسی ستمکارتر از کسی است که با آیات پروردگارش پند داده شود و او از آنها روی بگرداند (و درس نگیرد و فرمان نپذیرد، و عاقبتِ معاصی و گناهانی را که کرده است) و آنچه را که با دست خود پیشاپیش فرستاده است، فراموش کند؟! ما بر دلهای آنان (به سبب کفر گرائیشان) پرده‌هائی افکنده‌ایم تا آیات را نفهمند (و نور ایمان به دلهایشان نتابد) و به گوشهایشان سنگینی انداخته‌ایم (تا ندای حق را نشنوند) و لذا هرچند آنان را به سوی هدایت بخوانی، هرگز راهیاب نمی‌شوند (و به دین حق نمی‌گروند). [[«أکِنَّةً» و «أن یَفْقَهُوهُ» و «وَقْراً»: (نگا: أنعام / 25، إسراء / 46).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و کیست ستمکارتر از کسی که به آیات پروردگارش پند داده شود و از آن روی بگرداند و کار و کردار پیشین خود را فراموش کند، ما بر دلهایشان پرده‌هایی کشیده‌ایم که آن [پیام‌] را در نیابند و در گوشهای آنان سنگینی‌ای [نهاده‌ایم‌] و اگر ایشان را به سوی هدایت فراخوانی، هرگز و به هیچ وجه راه نیابند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: چه کسی ستمکارتر است از آن کس که آیات پروردگارش به او تذکّر داده شده، و از آن روی گرداند، و آنچه را با دستهای خود پیش فرستاد فراموش کرد؟! ما بر دلهای اینها پرده‌هایی افکنده‌ایم تا نفهمند؛ و در گوشهایشان سنگینی قرار داده‌ایم (تا صدای حق را نشنوند)! و از این رو اگر آنها را به سوی هدایت بخوانی، هرگز هدایت نمی‌شوند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و کیست ستمگرتر از آنکه یادآوری شد به آیتهای خدا پس روی گردانید از آنها و فراموش کرد آنچه را پیش فرستاد دستهایش همانا نهادیم بر دلهای ایشان پوششهائی از آنکه دریابندش و در گوشهای ایشان سنگینی را و اگر خوانیشان بسوی هدایت هرگز هدایت نشوند هیچگاه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ستمكارتر از آن كس كيست كه به آيات پروردگارش پند داده شود پس، از آنها روى بگرداند و آنچه را دو دستش پيش فرستاده- كردارهاى زشتش- فراموش كند. ما بر دلهاشان پوششها نهاده‌ايم تا آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و کیست ستمکارتر از آن کس که به آیات پروردگارش تذکر داده شده، پس از آن روی برتافته و دستاورد پیشینه‌ی خود را که از پیش فرستاده فراموش کند؟ ما بر دلهایشان پوشش‌هایی سخت قرار دادیم، تا آن را در نیابند و در گوش‌هایشان سنگینی (نهادیم). و اگر آنها را سوی هدایت فراخوانی هرگز راه نیابند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Who is more unjust than he who, on being reminded of his Lord's revelations, turns away from them, and forgets the evil deeds he had committed in the past. Verily We have placed a covering on their hearts so that they do not understand, and a deafness in their ears so that however you may call them to guidance they will never be guided aright.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And who is more unjust than one who, when reminded of the signs of his Lord, turns away from them and forgets what his hands have sent forward? We have put covers on their hearts so as not to understand the Qur’an, and deafness in their ears; and even if you call them to guidance, they will never attain the right path.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And who does greater evil than he who, being reminded of the signs of his Lord, turns away from them and forgets what his hands have forwarded? Surely We have laid veils on their hearts lest they understand it, and in their ears heaviness; and though thou callest them to the guidance, yet they will not be guided ever.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And who doth greater wrong than he who is admonished with the signs of His Lord yet turneth away from them and forgetteth that which his hands have sent forth? Verily We have set up veils over lest they should understand it, and in their ears a heaviness; and if thou callest them to the guidance, lo! they will not let themselves be guided ever.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And who does more wrong than he who is reminded of the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of his Lord, but turns away from them forgetting what (deeds) his hands have sent forth. Truly, We have set veils over their hearts lest they should understand this (the Quran), and in their ears, deafness. And if you (O Muhammad SAW) call them to guidance, even then they will never be guided.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Who does greater wrong than he, who, when reminded of his Lord’s revelations, turns away from them, and forgets what his hands have put forward? We have placed coverings over their hearts, lest they understand it, and heaviness in their ears. And if you call them to guidance, they will not be guided, ever.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Who is more wicked than the man who, when he is reminded by the revelations of his Lord, turns away from them and forgets (the consequence of) the deeds wrought by his own hands? We have laid veils over their hearts lest they understand the message of the Qur'an, and We have caused heaviness in their ears. Call them as you may to the Right Path, they will not be ever guided aright.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And who does more wrong than he who is reminded of the Ayat (signs) of his Lord, but turns away from them, forgetting what his hands have sent forth. Truly, We have set over their hearts Akinnah, lest they should understand this (the Qur'an), and in their ears, deafness. And if you call them to guidance, even then they will never be guided.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And who doth greater wrong than he who hath been reminded of the revelations of his Lord, yet turneth away from them and forgetteth what his hands send forward (to the Judgment)? Lo! on their hearts We have placed coverings so that they understand not, and in their ears a deafness. And though thou call them to the guidance, in that case they can never be led aright.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Who is a greater wrongdoer than he who is reminded of the signs of his Lord, whereat he disregards them and forgets what his hands have sent ahead? Indeed We have cast veils on their hearts lest they should understand it, and a deafness into their ears; and if you invite them to guidance they will never [let themselves] be guided.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Who is greater in evil than he who, when reminded of the verses of his Lord, turns away from them and forgets what his hands have sent before him? We have placed veils over their hearts lest they should understand it, and there is heaviness in their ears. Even if you call them to guidance, they will never be guided.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Who are more unjust than those who are reminded of the revelations of their Lord but have disregarded them and have forgotten their deeds? We have veiled their hearts and sealed their ears so that they cannot understand. Even if you call them to the right path, they will never accept guidance.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And who is more unjust than he who is reminded of the communications of his Lord, then he turns away from them and forgets what his two hands have sent before? Surely We have placed veils over their hearts lest they should understand it and a heaviness in their ears; and if you call them to the guidance, they will not ever follow the right course in that case.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waman athlamu mimman thukkira biayati rabbihi faaAArada AAanha wanasiya ma qaddamat yadahu inna jaAAalna AAala quloobihim akinnatan an yafqahoohu wafee athanihim waqran wain tadAAuhum ila alhuda falan yahtadoo ithan abadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Who is more wicked than he who has been reminded of the revelations of his Lord, then turns away from them and forgets what his own hands have done? We have cast veils over their hearts lest they understand Our words, and made them hard of hearing. Call them as you may to the right path, they shall never be guided.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And who doth more wrong than one who is reminded of the Signs of his Lord, but turns away from them, forgetting the (deeds) which his hands have sent forth? Verily We have set veils over their hearts lest they should understand this, and over their ears, deafness, if thou callest them to guidance, even then will they never accept guidance.

verses.text: وَ رَبُّکَ‌ الْغَفُورُ ذُو الرَّحْمَةِ لَوْ يُؤَاخِذُهُمْ‌ بِمَا کَسَبُوا لَعَجَّلَ‌ لَهُمُ‌ الْعَذَابَ‌ بَلْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ مَوْعِدٌ لَنْ‌ يَجِدُوا مِنْ‌ دُونِهِ‌ مَوْئِلاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و پروردگارت بسیار آمرزنده [و] صاحب رحمت است. اگر می خواست آنان را به کیفر گناهانی که مرتکب شده اند، مؤاخذه کند، قطعاً در عذابشان شتاب می نمود [اما چنین نمی کند]، بلکه آنان را وعده گاهی است که هرگز در برابر آن کمترین پناهگاهی نخواهند یافت.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پروردگارت آمرزنده و مهربان است. اگر مى‌خواست به سبب كردارشان در اين جهان بازخواستشان كند، بى‌درنگ به عذابشان مى‌سپرد. اما عذاب را زمانى معين است كه چون فرازآيد، پناهگاهى نيابند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و پروردگار تو آمرزنده و صاحب رحمت است. اگر مردم را به عملشان مى‌گرفت، حتما عذاب را زودتر به آنها مى‌رسانيد، ولى براى آنها موعدى است كه هرگز از آن گريزى نمى‌يابند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و پروردگار تو آمرزنده [و] صاحب رحمت است. اگر به [جرم‌] آنچه مرتكب شده‌اند، آنها را مؤاخذه مى‌كرد، قطعاً در عذاب آنان تعجيل مى‌نمود [ولى چنين نمى كند] بلكه براى آنها سر رسيدى است كه هرگز از برابر آن راه گريزى نمى‌يابند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و خدای تو بسیار آمرزنده و بی‌نهایت دارای کرم و رحمت است، اگر خواهد تا خلق را به کردارشان مؤاخذه کند همانا در عذابشان تعجیل و تسریع کند و لیکن برای (عذاب) آنان وقت معین (در عالم قیامت) مقرر است که از آن هرگز پناه و گریزگاهی نخواهند یافت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پروردگار تو بس آمرزنده و صاحب رحم است. اگر آنان را (فوراً) در برابر اعمالشان مجازات می‌نمود (می‌توانست و) هرچه زودتر عذاب را (همچون ملّتهای گذشته) گریبانگیرشان می‌کرد، ولی موعدی دارند که با فرا رسیدن آن راه نجاتی و پناهی در مقابلش نمی‌یابند. [[«مِن دُونِهِ»: در مقابل آن موعد. بجز خدا. «لَن یَجِدُوا مِن دُونِهِ مَوْئِلاً»: از دست آن پناهگاهی نمی‌یابند که خویشتن را در آن محفوظ دارند. با فرا رسیدن آن، پناهگاهی جز خدا نمی‌یابند که بتواند ایشان را مصون دارد. «مَوْئِلاً»: ملجأ. پناهگاه.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و پروردگار تو آمرزگار صاحب رحمت است، اگر آنان را به خاطر آنچه کرده‌اند، فرو می‌گرفت، عذابشان را پیش می‌انداخت، ولی برای آنان میعادی مقرر است که در برابر آن پناهگاهی نمی‌یابند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و پروردگارت، آمرزنده و صاحب رحمت است؛ اگر می‌خواست آنان را به خاطر اعمالشان مجازات کند، عذاب را هر چه زودتر برای آنها می‌فرستاد؛ ولی برای آنان موعدی است که هرگز از آن راه فراری نخواهند داشت!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و پروردگار تو است آمرزنده صاحب رحمت اگر گرفتارشان کند بدانچه فراهم کردند هر آینه بشتابد برای ایشان در عذاب بلکه ایشان را است وعده‌گاهی که هرگز نیابند جز آن پناهگاهی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و پروردگار تو آمرزگار و خداوند مِهر و بخشايش است اگر آنان را به سزاى آنچه كرده‌اند بازخواست مى‌كرد هر آينه در عذابشان شتاب مى‌نمود، اما آنان را هنگامى و وعده‌گاهى است كه از آن گريزگاه و پناهگاهى نيابند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و پروردگارت بسی پوشاننده‌ی کانون رحمت است. اگر به (جرم) دستاوردهاشان، آنان را مؤاخذه کند، بی‌گمان در عذابشان تعجیل می‌نماید. (ولی چنین نمی‌کند) بلکه برای آنها سررسیدی است که هرگز پس از آن راه گریزی نمی‌یابند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But your Lord is forgiving, full of benevolence. If He had pleased to punish them for their doings He would have punished them immediately. But a term is fixed for them from which they will find no escape.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And your Lord is the Oft Forgiver, the Merciful; if He seized them for their deeds, He would soon send the punishment upon them; but for them is an appointed time from which they will not find any refuge.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But thy Lord is the All-forgiving, full of mercy. If He should take them to task for that they have earned, He would hasten for them the chastisement; but they have a tryst, from which they will find no escape.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And thy Lord is the Forgiver, Owner of mercy. Were He to call them to account for that which they have earned; He would have hastened for them torment; but for them is a tryst beside which they cannot find a place to betake themselves to.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And your Lord is Most Forgiving, Owner of Mercy. Were He to call them to account for what they have earned, then surely, He would have hastened their punishment. But they have their appointed time, beyond which they will find no escape.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Your Lord is the Forgiver, Possessor of Mercy. Were He to call them to account for what they have earned, He would have hastened the punishment for them. But they have an appointment from which they will find no escape.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Your Lord is All-Forgiving, full of mercy. Had He wished to take them to task for their doings, He would have hastened in sending His scourge upon them. But He has set for them a time-limit which they cannot evade.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And your Lord is Most Forgiving, Owner of mercy. Were He to call them to account for what they have earned, then surely, He would have hastened their punishment. But they have their appointed time, beyond which they will find no escape.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thy Lord is the Forgiver, Full of Mercy. If He took them to task (now) for what they earn, He would hasten on the doom for them; but theirs is an appointed term from which they will find no escape.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Your Lord is the All-forgiving dispenser of mercy. Were He to take them to task because of what they have committed, He would have surely hastened their punishment. But they have a tryst, [when] they will not find a refuge besides Him.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Your Lord is Forgiving, Owner of Mercy. Had it been His will to take them to task for what they earned, He would have hastened their punishment; but they have an appointed hour from which they will never escape.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And your Lord is the Forgiving, full of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Your Lord is All-forgiving and All-merciful. Had He wanted to punish them for their sins, He would have been prompt to torment them. For their punishment there is an appointed time, after which there will be no way for them to escape.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And your Lord is Forgiving, the Lord of Mercy; were He to punish them for what they earn, He would certainly have hastened the chastisement for them; but for them there is an appointed time from which they shall not find a refuge.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Warabbuka alghafooru thoo alrrahmati law yuakhithuhum bima kasaboo laAAajjala lahumu alAAathaba bal lahum mawAAidun lan yajidoo min doonihi mawilan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Your Lord is the Forgiving One, the possessor of mercy. If He had to take them to task for the wrongs they have done, He would have hastened their punishment. They have an appointed time beyond which there will be no escape for them.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But your Lord is Most forgiving, full of Mercy. If He were to call them (at once) to account for what they have earned, then surely He would have hastened their punishment: but they have their appointed time, beyond which they will find no refuge.

verses.text: وَ تِلْکَ‌ الْقُرَى‌ أَهْلَکْنَاهُمْ‌ لَمَّا ظَلَمُوا وَ جَعَلْنَا لِمَهْلِکِهِمْ‌ مَوْعِداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و آن شهرها [یی که داستانشان را بر تو خواندیم] هنگامی که اهل آنها [با کفر و تکذیب آیات خدا] به خود ستم ورزیدند، هلاکشان کردیم، و برای هلاکتشان وقتی معلوم مقرّر نمودیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آن قريه‌ها را چون كافر شدند به هلاكت رسانيديم و براى هلاكتشان وعده‌اى نهاديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و مردم آن شهرها را چون بيدادگرى كردند هلاك كرديم و براى هلاكتشان موعدى نهاديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [مردم‌] آن شهرها چون بيدادگرى كردند، هلاكشان كرديم، و براى هلاكتشان موعدى مقرر داشتيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و این است شهر و دیارهایی که اهل آن را چون ظلم و ستم کردند هلاک ساختیم و بر وقت هلاکشان موعدی معلوم مقرر گردانیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و اینها شهرها و آبادیهائی است (از عاد و ثمود و قوم لوط و امثال ایشان) که ما (در رساندن عذابشان شتاب ننموده‌ایم و بلکه) موعدی برای هلاکشان تعیین کرده‌ایم و زمانی آنها را نابود ساخته‌ایم که ایشان ظلم و ستم پیشه کرده‌اند. [[«الْقُرَی»: شهرها و آبادیها. مجازاً مراد مردمان آنجاها است. «مَهْلِک»: هلاک و نابودی. مصدر میمی است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و این شهرهایی است که چون [اهلش‌] ستم ورزیدند، نابودشان کردیم، و برای نابودیشان میعادی مقرر داشتیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این شهرها و آبادیهایی است که ما آنها را هنگامی که ستم کردند هلاک نمودیم؛ و برای هلاکتشان موعدی قرار دادیم! (آنها ویرانه‌هایش را با چشم می‌بینند، و عبرت نمی‌گیرند!)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اینک شهرها نابود کردیم آنها را گاهی که ستم کردند و نهادیم برای نابودیشان وعده‌گاهی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [مردم‌] آن آباديها و شهرها را چون ستم كردند هلاك كرديم و براى هلاكتشان وعده‌گاهى نهاديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و چون آن گروه‌ها بیدادگری کردند، هلاکشان کردیم، و برای هلاکتشان موعدی مقرر داشتیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: As for these habitations, We destroyed them only when they transgressed; even so We had fixed a time for their annihilation.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And these towns – We destroyed them when they committed injustice, and We had set an appointed time for their destruction.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And those cities, We destroyed them when they did evil, and appointed for their destruction a tryst.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And these cities! We destroyed them when they did wrong, and We had appointed for their destruction a tryst.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And these towns (population, 'Ad, Thamud, etc.) We destroyed when they did wrong. And We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And these towns—We destroyed them when they committed injustices, and We set for their destruction an appointed time.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: All the townships afflicted with scourge are before your eyes. When they committed wrong, We destroyed them. For the destruction of each We had set a definite term.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And these towns, We destroyed them when they did wrong. And We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And (all) those townships! We destroyed them when they did wrong, and We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Those are the towns that We destroyed when they were wrongdoers, and We appointed a tryst for their destruction.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And those villages! When they became evil We destroyed them and appointed a meeting for their destruction.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We only destroyed the inhabitants of certain towns when they had committed injustice and did not repent before Our deadline.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And (as for) these towns, We destroyed them when they acted unjustly, and We have appointed a time for their destruction.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Watilka alqura ahlaknahum lamma thalamoo wajaAAalna limahlikihim mawAAidan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We destroyed these communities when they went on doing wrong, and We appointed a time for their destruction.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Such were the populations we destroyed when they committed iniquities; but we fixed an appointed time for their destruction.

verses.text: وَ إِذْ قَالَ‌ مُوسَى‌ لِفَتَاهُ‌ لاَ أَبْرَحُ‌ حَتَّى‌ أَبْلُغَ‌ مَجْمَعَ‌ الْبَحْرَيْنِ‌ أَوْ أَمْضِيَ‌ حُقُباً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [یاد کن] هنگامی را که موسی به جوان [خدمت گزار] خود گفت: همواره می روم تا به محل برخورد آن دو دریا برسم [چه اینکه زود برسم] یا روزگاری طولانی به سفرم ادامه دهم، [در هر حال می روم تا برای تحصیل دانش بیشتر، عبد صالح حق را بیابم.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و موسى به شاگرد خود گفت: من همچنان خواهم رفت تا آنجا كه دو دريا به هم رسيده‌اند. يا مى‌رسم، يا عمرم به سر مى‌آيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و هنگامى كه موسى به جوان [همراه‌] خود گفت: همچنان خواهم رفت تا به محل تلاقى دو دريا برسم، هر چند مدتى طولانى به راه خود ادامه دهم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [ياد كن‌] هنگامى را كه موسى به جوانِ [همراه‌] خود گفت: «دست بردار نيستم تا به محل برخورد دو دريا برسم، هر چند سالها[ى سال‌] سير كنم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و (به یاد آر) وقتی که موسی به شاگردش (یوشع که وصی و خلیفه او بود) گفت: من دست از طلب برندارم تا به مجمع البحرین (به محل برخورد دو دریا) برسم یا سالها عمر در طلب بگذرانم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (یادآور شو) زمانی را که موسی (پسر عمران، همراه با یوشع پسر نون، که خادم و شاگرد او بود، به امر خدا برای یافتن شخص فرزانه‌ای به نام خضر بیرون رفت تا از او چیزهائی بیاموزد. موسی برای پیدا کردن این دانشمند بزرگ نشانه‌هائی در دست داشت، همچون محلّ تلاقی دو دریا و زنده شدن ماهی بریان شده. موسی عزم خود را جزم کرد و) به جوان (خدمتگذار) خود گفت: من هرگز از پای نمی‌نشینم تا این که به محلّ برخورد دو دریا می‌رسم، و یا این که روزگاران زیادی راه می‌سپرم. [[«فَتَاهُ»: خادم خود. فَتی به معنی جوان است که محض احترام خطاب به خدمتگذار گفته می‌شود. «لآ أَبْرَحُ»: پیوسته راه می‌روم. همیشه در طلب خواهم بود (نگا: یوسف / 80). «مَجْمَعَ الْبَحْرَیْنِ»: محلّ تلاقی دو دریا. در قرآن این محلّ روشن نشده است، لیکن مفسّران گفته‌اند: مراد محلّ اتّصال خلیج عقبه و خلیج سوئز، یا محلّ پیوند اقیانوس هند با دریای احمر در بغاز باب‌المندب، و یا این که محلّ پیوستگی دریای مدیترانه و اقیانوس اطلس است. «حُقُباً»: روزگاران. مدّت زیادی از زمان که آن را هفتاد و هشتاد سال تخمین زده‌اند. جمع آن أَحْقاب است (نگا: نبأ / 23).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چنین بود که موسی به شاگردش گفت دست از سیر و طلب برندارم تا به مجمع‌البحرین برسم، یا آنکه روزگارانی دراز راه بپیمایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: به خاطر بیاور هنگامی را که موسی به دوست خود گفت: دست از جستجو برنمی‌دارم تا به محل تلاقی دو دریا برسم؛ هر چند مدت طولانی به راه خود ادامه دهم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و هنگامی که گفت موسی به جوان خویش نروم (دست برندارم) تا نرسم ملتقای (رسیدنگاه) دو دریا را یا راه سپرم هفتاد سال‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و [ياد كن‌] آنگاه كه موسى شاگرد خود- يوشع پسر نون- را گفت: من پيوسته خواهم رفت تا به جاى به هم آمدن دو دريا برسم، يا سالهايى دراز راه پويم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و چون موسی به جوان [:دستیار] خود گفت: «از این جا دست‌بردار نیستم تا به محل برخورد دو دریا برسم یا زمان‌هایی سیر کنم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When Moses said to his servant (Joshua): "I will not give up till I reach the confluence of two oceans, or I will journey on and on."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And recall when Moosa said to his assistant, “I will not give up until I reach the place where the two seas meet or until I have progressed for ages.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And when Moses said to his page, 'I will not give up until I reach the meeting of the two seas, though I go on for many years.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And recall what time Musa said unto his page: I shall not cease until I reach the confluence of the two seas, or I shall go on for ages.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And (remember) when Musa (Moses) said to his boy-servant: "I will not give up (travelling) until I reach the junction of the two seas or (until) I spend years and years in travelling."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Recall when Moses said to his servant, “I will not give up until I reach the junction of the two rivers, even if it takes me years.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (And recount to them the story of Moses) when Moses said to his servant: "I will journey on until I reach the point where the two rivers meet, though I may march on for ages."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And (remember) when Musa said to his boy-servant: "I will not give up until I reach the junction of the two seas or a Huqub passes."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when Moses said unto his servant: I will not give up until I reach the point where the two rivers meet, though I march on for ages.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When Moses said to his lad, ‘I will go on [journeying] until I have reached the confluence of the two seas, or have spent a long time [travelling].’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When Moses said to his (assisting) youth: 'I will not give up until I reach the point where the two seas meet even though I should go on for many years'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And [mention] when Moses said to his servant, "I will not cease [traveling] until I reach the junction of the two seas or continue for a long period."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Consider) when Moses said to his young companion, "I shall continue travelling until I reach the junction of the two seas or have travelled for many years".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And when Musa said to his servant: I will not cease until I reach the junction of the two rivers or I will go on for years.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waith qala moosa lifatahu la abrahu hatta ablugha majmaAAa albahrayni aw amdiya huquban

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Recall how Moses said to his servant, "I shall not give up until I reach the place where both seas meet, even if it takes me years!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Behold, Moses said to his attendant, "I will not give up until I reach the junction of the two seas or (until) I spend years and years in travel."

verses.text: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَا مَجْمَعَ‌ بَيْنِهِمَا نَسِيَا حُوتَهُمَا فَاتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُ‌ فِي‌ الْبَحْرِ سَرَباً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس هنگامی که به محل برخورد دو دریا رسیدند، ماهی خود را [که برای خوردن فراهم کرده بودند] از یاد بردند، [آن] ماهی راه خود را [به طور سرازیر] در دریا پیش گرفت.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون آن دو به آنجا كه دو دريا به هم رسيده بودند رسيدند، ماهيشان را فراموش كردند و ماهى راه دريا گرفت و در آب شد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس چون به محل تلاقى آن دو دريا رسيدند، ماهى خود را [كه براى تغذيه بود] فراموش كردند، پس [ماهى‌] راه خود را در دريا پيش گرفت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس چون به محل برخورد دو [دريا] رسيدند، ماهىِ خودشان را فراموش كردند، و ماهى در دريا راه خود را در پيش گرفت [و رفت‌].

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و چون موسی و شاگردش بدان مجمع البحرین رسیدند ماهی غذای خود را فراموش کردند و آن ماهی راه به دریا برگرفت و رفت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که به محلّ تلاقی دو دریا رسیدند، ماهی خویش را از یاد بردند، و ماهی در دریا راه خود را پیش گرفت (و به درون آن خزید). [[«حُوتَ»: ماهی. ظاهراً این ماهی را به عنوان غذا تهیّه کرده و با خود می‌بردند و از آن می‌خوردند. «سَرَباً»: راه سراشیبی. طریق و مسیر. مفعول دوم فعل (إِتَّخَذَ) است. برخی آن را مصدر و در معنی اسم فاعل یعنی سارِب گرفته‌اند و حال فاعل فعل (إِتَّخَذَ) بشمار آورده‌اند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون به مجمع بین آن دو [دریا] رسیدند ماهیشان را فراموش کردند که راهش را به میان دریا در پیش گرفته بود و روانه شده بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (ولی) هنگامی که به محل تلاقی آن دو دریا رسیدند، ماهی خود را (که برای تغذیه همراه داشتند) فراموش کردند؛ و ماهی راه خود را در دریا پیش گرفت (و روان شد).

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس هنگامی که رسیدند مجمع (رسیدنگاه) آن دو را فراموش کردند ماهی خویش را تا برگرفت راه خویش را در دریا شکافنده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چون به جاى به هم آمدن آن دو دريا رسيدند ماهى خود را فراموش كردند و آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چون به محل برخورد دو (دریا) رسیدند، ماهیشان را فراموش کردند. پس ماهی راه راهوارش را به سراشیبی دریا پیش گرفت .

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When they reached the confluence they forgot the fish (they had brought as food) which swiftly made its way into the sea.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And when they reached the place where the two seas meet, they forgot about their fish, and it took its way into the sea, making a tunnel. (The dead fish came alive and went into the water.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then, when they reached their meeting, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the sea, burrowing.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And when the twain reached the confluence of the two, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the sea freely.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But when they reached the junction of the two seas, they forgot their fish, and it took its way through the sea as in a tunnel.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then, when they reached the junction between them, they forgot about their fish. It found its way into the river, slipping away.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But when they reached the point where the two rivers meet, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the sea, as if through a tunnel.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But when they reached the junction of the two seas, they forgot their fish, and it took its way through the sea as in a tunnel.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when they reached the point where the two met, they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the waters, being free.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So when they reached the confluence between them, they forgot their fish, which found its way into the sea, sneaking away.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But when they came to the point where the two met, they forgot their fish, which made its way burrowing into the sea.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When they reached the junction of the two seas they found out that they had forgotten all about the fish (which they had carried for food). The fish found its way into the sea.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So when they had reached the junction of the two (rivers) they forgot their fish, and it took its way into the sea, going away.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma balagha majmaAAa baynihima nasiya hootahuma faittakhatha sabeelahu fee albahri saraban

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But when at last they came to the land where the two seas met, they forgot their fish and it swiftly made its way into the sea.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But when they reached the Junction, they forgot (about) their Fish, which took its course through the sea (straight) as in a tunnel.

verses.text: فَلَمَّا جَاوَزَا قَالَ‌ لِفَتَاهُ‌ آتِنَا غَدَاءَنَا لَقَدْ لَقِينَا مِنْ‌ سَفَرِنَا هٰذَا نَصَباً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: وقتی [از آنجا] گذشتند، موسی به خدمت گزارش گفت: غذای صبح گاهی ما را بیاور که از این سفرمان سختی و خستگیِ بسیار دیدیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون از آنجا گذشتند، به شاگرد خود گفت: چاشتمان را بياور كه در اين سفرمان رنج فراوان ديده‌ايم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چون از آن جا گذشتند، موسى به جوان همراه خود گفت: غذايمان را بياور كه راستى ما از اين سفر خستگى بسيار ديديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و هنگامى كه [از آنجا] گذشتند [موسى‌] به جوان خود گفت: «غذايمان را بياور كه راستى ما از اين سفر رنج بسيار ديديم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس چون که از آن مکان بگذشتند موسی به شاگردش گفت: چاشت ما را بیاور که ما در این سفر رنج بسیار دیدیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که (از آنجا) دور شدند (و راه زیادی را طی کردند، موسی) به خدمتکارش گفت: غذای ما را بیاور، واقعاً در این سفرمان دچار خستگی و رنج زیادی شده‌ایم. [[«جَاوَزَا»: گذشتند. دور شدند. «غَدَآءَ»: خوراک. چاشت. «نَصَباً»: رنج و خستگی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون چندی از آنجا گذشتند [موسی‌] به شاگردش گفت غذایمان را بیاور که از این سفرمان خستگی و ماندگی دیده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که از آن جا گذشتند، (موسی) به یار همسفرش گفت: «غذای ما را بیاور، که سخت از این سفر خسته شده‌ایم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس هنگامی که گذشتند گفت به جوان خود بیاور برای ما چاشت ما را همانا رسیدیم از سفر خویش این رنجی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چون از آنجا گذشتند، به شاگرد خود گفت: چاشتمان را بيار، كه در اين سفرمان رنجى سخت ديده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و هنگامی که (از آنجا) گذشتند (موسی) به جوان [:دستیار] خود گفت: «غذایمان را بیاور، به‌راستی ما از این سفر به رنجی بسیار دچار شدیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When they had gone past (the confluence), Moses said to his servant: "Give me my breakfast. I am exhausted from this journey."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So when they had gone beyond that place, Moosa said to his assistant, “Bring our breakfast – we have indeed faced great exertion in this journey of ours.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: When they had passed over, he said to his page, 'Bring us our breakfast; indeed, we have encountered weariness from this our journey.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And when the twain had passed by, he said unto his page: bring us our morning-meal, assuredly we have met from this journey of ours, toil

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So when they had passed further on (beyond that fixed place), Musa (Moses) said to his boy-servant: "Bring us our morning meal; truly, we have suffered much fatigue in this, our journey."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When they went further, he said to his servant, “Bring us our lunch; we were exposed in our travel to much fatigue.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When they had journeyed further on, Moses said to his servant: "Bring us our repast. We are surely fatigued by today's journey."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So when they passed further on, Musa said to his boy-servant: "Bring us our morning meal; truly, we have suffered Nasaban in this, our journey."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And when they had gone further, he said unto his servant: Bring us our breakfast. Verily we have found fatigue in this our journey.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So when they had passed on, he said to his lad, ‘Bring us our meal. We have certainly encountered much fatigue on this journey of ours.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And when they had gone further, he said to his assisting youth; 'Bring us our breakfast; we are worn out from our journey'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So when they had passed beyond it, [Moses] said to his boy, "Bring us our morning meal. We have certainly suffered in this, our journey, [much] fatigue."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Moses asked his young companion when they crossed this point, "Bring us our food; the journey has made us tired."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But when they had gone farther, he said to his servant: Bring to us our morning meal, certainly we have met with fatigue from this our journey.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma jawaza qala lifatahu atina ghadaana laqad laqeena min safarina hatha nasaban

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: After they had passed the place, Moses said to his young companion, "Bring us our morning meal; we have indeed been fatigued by this journey."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: When they had passed on (some distance), Moses said to his attendant: "Bring us our early meal; truly we have suffered much fatigue at this (stage of) our journey."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ أَ رَأَيْتَ‌ إِذْ أَوَيْنَا إِلَى‌ الصَّخْرَةِ فَإِنِّي‌ نَسِيتُ‌ الْحُوتَ‌ وَ مَا أَنْسَانِيهُ‌ إِلاَّ الشَّيْطَانُ‌ أَنْ‌ أَذْکُرَهُ‌ وَ اتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُ‌ فِي‌ الْبَحْرِ عَجَباً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: خدمت گزارش گفت: آیا ندانستی چون کنار آن سنگ جای گرفتیم، من ماهی را از یاد بردم و آن با وضعی شگفت انگیز راه خود را در دریا گرفت و رفت، و جز شیطان از خاطرم نبرد که آن را به یاد داشته باشم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: آيا به ياد دارى آنگاه را كه در كنار آن صخره مكان گرفته بوديم؟ من ماهى را فراموش كرده‌ام. و اين شيطان بود كه سبب شد فراموشش كنم و ماهى به شيوه‌اى شگفت‌انگيز به دريا رفت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: آيا به ياد دارى؟ وقتى كنار آن صخره جا گرفته بوديم، من [به آب افتادن‌] ماهى را فراموش كردم [كه با تو بگويم‌] و جز شيطان فراموشم نساخت از اين كه يادآور آن شوم، و ماهى به طور عجيبى راه خود را در دريا پيش گرفت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «ديدى؟ وقتى به سوى آن صخره پناه جستيم، من ماهى را فراموش كردم، و جز شيطان، [كسى‌] آن را از ياد من نبرد، تا به يادش باشم، و به طور عجيبى راه خود را در دريا پيش گرفت.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: وی گفت: در نظر داری آنجا که بر سر سنگی منزل گرفتیم؟ من (آنجا) ماهی را فراموش کردم و آن را جز شیطان از یادم نبرد و شگفت آنکه ماهی بریان راه دریا گرفت و برفت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (خدمتکارش) گفت: به یاد داری وقتی را که به آن صخره رفتیم (و استراحت کردیم)! من (بازگو کردن جریان عجیب زنده شدن و به درون آب شیرجه رفتن) ماهی را از یاد بردم (که در آنجا جلو چشمانم روی داد!). جز شیطان بازگو کردن آن را از خاطرم نبرده است. (بلی! ماهی پس از زنده شدن) به طرز شگفت‌انگیزی راه خود را در دریا پیش گرفت. [[«أَوَیْنَا»: پناه بردیم و اقامت گزیدیم. «الصَّخْرَةِ»: سنگ بزرگ و سخت. «مَآ أَنسَانِیهُ»: آن را از یادم نبرده است. ضمیر (هُ) می‌بایست به صورت (هِ) و مکسور خوانده شود، ولی مضموم بودن آن برابر قرائت حفص و یکی از لغات عرب است (نگا: فتح / 10). «عَجَباً»: به گونه شگفت‌انگیز. راه شگفت‌انگیز. این واژه صفت مصدر محذوف، یعنی: إِتِّخَاذاً عَجَباً، و یا این که مفعول دوم (إِتَّخَذَ) می‌باشد. «وَ اتَّخَذَ سَبِیلَهُ فِی الْبَحْرِ عَجَباً»: ماهی به گونه شگفتی بعد از زنده شدن به دریا فرو رفت. برخی نیز گفته‌اند: خدمتکار به گونه بس استوار و سرحال برای جبران فراموشی به سوی دریا برای گرفتن ماهی یا ماهیهای دیگری رفت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت ملاحظه کن، وقتی که در کنار آن تخته‌سنگ آرام گرفتیم، من [داستان‌] ماهی را فراموش کردم و جز شیطان آن را از یاد من نبرد که [به شما] بگویم و [آن ماهی‌] با کمال شگفتی راهش را به میان دریا در پیش گرفت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «به خاطر داری هنگامی که ما (برای استراحت) به کنار آن صخره پناه بردیم، من (در آن جا) فراموش کردم جریان ماهی را بازگو کنم -و فقط شیطان بود که آن را از خاطر من برد- و ماهی بطرز شگفت‌آوری راه خود را در دریا پیش گرفت!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت آیا دیدی گاهی که جای گرفتیم نزدیک آن سنگ همانا فراموش کردم ماهی را و فراموشم نکرد جز شیطان از آنکه به یاد آرمش و برگرفت راه خود را در دریا شگفت‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [شاگردش‌] گفت: آيا به ياد دارى آنگاه كه به آن سنگ جاى گرفته بوديم؟ من [داستان به دريا افتادن‌] ماهى را فراموش كردم [كه با تو بگويم‌]، و جز شيطان فراموشم نساخت از اينكه آن را ياد كنم، و به شيوه‌اى شگفت راه خود را در دريا پيش گرفت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «آیا دیدی‌؟ چون سوی آن صخره پناه جستیم، من بی‌گمان آن ماهی را فراموش کردم و جز شیطان (کسی) آن را از یادم نبرد، که به یادش باشم، و به گونه‌ای شگفت‌انگیز خود راه راهوارش در دریا را پیش گرفت.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He said: "You see, I forgot the fish on the rock where we had stopped. Only Satan made me forget to mention this; but the wonder is the fish escaped to the sea."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “Just imagine – when we had taken shelter near the rock, so indeed I forgot the fish; and none but Satan caused me to forget to mention it; and the fish took its way into the sea – its amazing!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'What thinkest thou? When we took refuge in the rock, then I forgot the fish-and it was Satan himself that made me forget it so that I should not remember it -- and so it took its way into the sea in a manner marvellous.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: lookest thou! when we betook ourselves to the rock, then forgot the fish; and naught but the Satan made me forget to mention it, and it took its way into the sea--a marvel!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He said:"Do you remember when we betook ourselves to the rock? I indeed forgot the fish, none but Shaitan (Satan) made me forget to remember it. It took its course into the sea in a strange (way)!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Do you remember when we rested by the rock? I forgot about the fish. It was only the devil who made me forget it. And so it found its way to the river, amazingly.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The servant said: "Did you see what happened? When we betook ourselves to the rock to take rest, I forgot the fish - and it is only Satan who caused me to forget to mention it to you - so that it made its way into the sea in a strange manner."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Do you remember when we betook ourselves to the rock I indeed forgot the fish; none but Shaytan made me forget to remember it. It took its course into the sea in a strange (way)!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Didst thou see, when we took refuge on the rock, and I forgot the fish - and none but Satan caused me to forget to mention it - it took its way into the waters by a marvel.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Did you see?! When we took shelter at the rock, indeed I forgot about the fish—and none but Satan made me forget to mention it!—and it made its way into the sea in an amazing manner!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He replied: 'What do you think, I forgot the fish when we were resting on the rock. None but satan made me forget to mention this it made its way into the sea in a marvelous fashion'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "Did you see when we retired to the rock? Indeed, I forgot [there] the fish. And none made me forget it except Satan - that I should mention it. And it took its course into the sea amazingly".

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: His companion replied, "Do you remember the rock on which we took rest? Satan made me forget to mention to you the story of the fish and how it miraculously made its way into the sea.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Did you see when we took refuge on the rock then I forgot the fish, and nothing made me forget to speak of it but the Shaitan, and it took its way into the river; what a wonder!

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala araayta ith awayna ila alssakhrati fainnee naseetu alhoota wama ansaneehu illa alshshaytanu an athkurahu waittakhatha sabeelahu fee albahri AAajaban

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He replied, "Did you see when we were resting by the rock, that I forgot the fish? Satan made me forget it, so I did not mention it. It made its way to the sea in a miraculous way!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He replied: "Sawest thou (what happened) when we betook ourselves to the rock? I did indeed forget (about) the Fish: none but Satan made me forget to tell (you) about it: it took its course through the sea in a marvellous way!"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ ذٰلِکَ‌ مَا کُنَّا نَبْغِ‌ فَارْتَدَّا عَلَى‌ آثَارِهِمَا قَصَصاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: موسی گفت: این [جای فراموش کردن ماهی] همان است که ما در طلبش بودیم. پس با پی گرفتن جای پای خود [از راهی که آمده بودند] برگشتند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: آنجا همان جايى است كه در طلبش بوده‌ايم. و به نشان قدمهاى خود جست‌وجوكنان بازگشتند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: اين همان [جايگاه خضر] است كه به دنبالش بوديم، آن‌گاه پى‌جويانه ردّ پاى خود را گرفتند و برگشتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «اين همان بود كه ما مى‌جستيم.» پس جستجوكنان ردّ پاى خود را گرفتند و برگشتند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: موسی گفت: آنجا همان مقصدی است که ما در طلب آن بودیم، و از آن راهی که آمدند به آنجا برگشتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: این چیزی است که ما می‌خواستیم (چرا که یکی از نشانه‌های پیدا کردن گمشده‌ی ما است) پس پیجویانه از راه طی شده‌ی خود برگشتند. [[«کُنَّا نَبْغِ»: می‌خواستیم. فعل مضارع (نَبْغِ) مرفوع است و در اصل چنین است: (نَبْغِی). کتابت آن بدون یاء، رسم‌الخطّ قرآنی است. «إِرْتَدَّا»: بازگشتند. به عقب برگشتند. «قَصَصاً»: پیجوئی. ردّ پای خود را گرفتن. می‌تواند مفعول مطلق فعلی از لفظ خود باشد: یَقُصّانِ قَصَصاً. یا این که مصدر مؤوّل به وصف بوده باشد، یعنی: (مُقَتَصِّینَ). به معنی: (مُتَتَبِّعِینَ).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت این همانجاست که ما جستجویش می‌کردیم، لذا پی‌جویانه بازگشتند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: «آن همان بود که ما می‌خواستیم!» سپس از همان راه بازگشتند، در حالی که پی‌جویی می‌کردند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت این است آنچه می‌خواستیم پس بازگشتند بر جای پایهای خویش پی‌جویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [موسى‌] گفت: آن همان است كه مى‌جستيم- يعنى جاى فراموش شدن ماهى همان جايگاه خضر است-، پس بر نشانه گامهاى خويش پى‌جويان بازگشتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «این (جریان) همان بود که ما آن را می‌جسته‌ایم.‌» پس جستجوکنان برگشته‌(و) دنبال ردّ پاهایشان را گرفتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Moses said: "But that is exactly what we were seeking." So they retraced their steps.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Moosa, “This is exactly what we wanted”; so they came back retracing their steps.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'This is what we were seeking!' And so they returned upon their tracks, retracing them.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Musa said: that is that which we have been seeking. So they turned back upon their footsteps, retracing.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "That is what we have been seeking." So they went back retracing their footsteps.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “This is what we were seeking.” And so they turned back retracing their steps.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Moses said: "That is what we were looking for." So the two turned back, retracing their footsteps,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: [Musa] said: "That is what we have been seeking." So they went back retracing their footsteps.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: This is that which we have been seeking. So they retraced their steps again.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘That is what we were after!’ So they returned, retracing their footsteps.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'This is what we have been seeking' said he, and they retraced their footsteps

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Moses] said, "That is what we were seeking." So they returned, following their footprints.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Moses said, "That is exactly what we are seeking. They followed their own foot prints back (to the rock)."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: This is what we sought for; so they returned retracing their footsteps.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala thalika ma kunna nabghi fairtadda AAala atharihima qasasan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Moses said, "That is just what we were looking for." So they went back the way they had come,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Moses said: "That was what we were seeking after:" So they went back on their footsteps, following (the path they had come).

verses.text: فَوَجَدَا عَبْداً مِنْ‌ عِبَادِنَا آتَيْنَاهُ‌ رَحْمَةً مِنْ‌ عِنْدِنَا وَ عَلَّمْنَاهُ‌ مِنْ‌ لَدُنَّا عِلْماً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس بنده ای از بندگان ما را یافتند که او را از نزد خود رحمتی داده و از پیشگاه خود دانشی ویژه به او آموخته بودیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در آنجا بنده‌اى از بندگان ما را كه رحمت خويش بر او ارزانى داشته بوديم و خود بدو دانش آموخته بوديم، بيافتند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: تا اين كه [خضر] بنده‌اى از بندگان ما را يافتند كه از جانب خود به او رحمتى عطا كرده و از نزد خود به او دانشى آموخته بوديم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: تا بنده‌اى از بندگان ما را يافتند كه از جانب خود به او رحمتى عطا كرده و از نزد خود بدو دانشى آموخته بوديم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در آنجا بنده‌ای از بندگان خاص ما را یافتند که او را رحمت و لطف خاصی از نزد خود عطا کردیم و هم از نزد خود وی را علم (لدنّی و اسرار غیب الهی) آموختیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس بنده‌ای از بندگان (صالح) ما را (به نام خضر) یافتند که ما او را مشمول رحمت خود ساخته و از جانب خویش بدو علم فراوانی داده بودیم. [[«عَبْداً»: این بنده خدا (خضر) نام داشته است و باید پیغمبر بوده باشد. چرا که: الف) خداوند نسبت بدو فرموده است: آتَیْناهُ رَحْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنا. رحمت هم به معنی نبوّت آمده است (نگا: زخرف / 32). ب) علم لدنی، مقتضی وحی است: وَ عَلَّمْنَاهُ مِن لَّدُنَّا عِلْماً. ج) او به موسی چیزهائی آموخته است، و پیغمبر هم جز از پیغمبر کسب علم نمی‌کند. د) جمله: ما فَعَلْتُهُ عَنْ أَمْرِی، در آیه (82 / کهف) دلیل نبوّت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه بنده‌ای از بندگان ما [خضر] را یافتند که به او رحمتی از سوی خویش ارزانی داشته و از پیشگاه خود به او علم [لدنی‌] آموخته بودیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (در آن جا) بنده‌ای از بندگان ما را یافتند که رحمت (و موهبت عظیمی) از سوی خود به او داده، و علم فراوانی از نزد خود به او آموخته بودیم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا یافتند بنده‌ای از بندگان ما را که داده بودیمش رحمتی را از نزد خود و آموخته بودیمش از نزد خود دانش را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس بنده‌اى از بندگان ما را يافتند كه او را از نزد خويش بخشايشى داده بوديم و او را از نزد خود دانشى آموخته بوديم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس بنده‌ای از بندگان ما را یافتند که رحمتی (ویژه) از خود به او دادیم، و از نزد خود بدو دانشی (ویژه) آموختیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then they found one of Our votaries, whom We had blessed and given knowledge from Us.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they found a bondman* from amongst Our (chosen) bondmen, to whom We had given mercy from Us, and had bestowed the inspired knowledge from Ourselves. (* Hazrat Khidr – peace be upon him.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then they found one of Our servants unto whom We had given mercy from Us, and We had taught him knowledge proceeding from Us.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then the twain found a bondman from Our bondmen, him We had vouchsafed a mercy from before Us, and him We had taught from Our presence a knowledge.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then they found one of Our slaves, unto whom We had bestowed mercy from Us, and whom We had taught knowledge from Us.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then they came upon a servant of Ours, whom We had blessed with mercy from Us, and had taught him knowledge from Our Own.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and there they found one of Our servants upon whom We had bestowed Our mercy, and to whom We had imparted a special knowledge from Ourselves.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then they found one of Our servants, on whom We had bestowed mercy from Us, and whom We had taught knowledge from Us.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then found they one of Our slaves, unto whom We had given mercy from Us, and had taught him knowledge from Our presence.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: [There] they found one of Our servants whom We had granted a mercy from Ourselves, and taught him a knowledge from Our own.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and found one of Our worshipers to whom We had given from Our Mercy, and to whom We had taught knowledge of Ours.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: There they met one of Our servants who had received blessings and knowledge from Us.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then they found one from among Our servants whom We had granted mercy from Us and whom We had taught knowledge from Ourselves.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fawajada AAabdan min AAibadina ataynahu rahmatan min AAindina waAAallamnahu min ladunna AAilman

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and they found one of Our servants to whom We had granted Our mercy and had given a knowledge from Ourself.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So they found one of Our servants, on whom We had bestowed Mercy from Ourselves and whom We had taught knowledge from Our own Presence.

verses.text: قَالَ‌ لَهُ‌ مُوسَى‌ هَلْ‌ أَتَّبِعُکَ‌ عَلَى‌ أَنْ‌ تُعَلِّمَنِ‌ مِمَّا عُلِّمْتَ‌ رُشْداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: موسی به او گفت: آیا [اذن می دهی که] من تو را [به این هدف] پیروی کنم که از آنچه به تو آموخته اند، مایه رشدی به من بیاموزی؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: موسى گفتش: آيا با تو بيايم تا از آنچه به تو آموخته‌اند به من كمالى بياموزى؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: موسى به او گفت: آيا از پى تو بيايم تا از حكمتى كه تعليم شده‌اى به من بياموزى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: موسى به او گفت: «آيا تو را -به شرط اينكه از بينشى كه آموخته شده‌اى به من ياد دهى- پيروى كنم؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: موسی به آن شخص دانا (و خضر زمان) گفت: آیا من تبعیت (و خدمت) تو کنم تا از علم لدنّی خود مرا بیاموزی؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: موسی بدو گفت: آیا (می‌پذیری که من همراه تو شوم و) از تو پیروی کنم بدان شرط که از آنچه مایه‌ی رشد و صلاح است و به تو آموخته شده است، به من بیاموزی؟ [[«عَلَی»: عَلی حرف جرّ است و در اینجا بیانگر معنی شرط است (نگا: ممتحنه / 12). «رُشْداً»: دانشی که موجب خیر و صلاح دین و دنیا شود (نگا: أنبیاء / 51). مصدر است و برای مبالغه در معنی وصفی به کار رفته است. یعنی: عِلْماً ذا رُشْدٍ. مفعول دوم فعل (تُعَلِّمَنی) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: موسی به او گفت آیا می‌توانم از شما پیروی کنم که از بینشی که آموخته‌ای به من نیز بیاموزی؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: موسی به او گفت: «آیا از تو پیروی کنم تا از آنچه به تو تعلیم داده شده و مایه رشد و صلاح است، به من بیاموزی؟»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت بدو موسی آیا پیرویت کنم بر آنکه بیاموزیم از آنچه آموخته شدی رهبری را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: موسى به او گفت: آيا [اجازه مى‌دهى كه‌] تو را پيروى كنم بر اينكه مرا از آنچه به تو آموخته‌اند بياموزى تا به راه راست و كمال راه يابم؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: موسی بدو گفت: «آیا تو را بر این مبنا که از دانشی (شایسته) که آموخته شده‌ای به من رشیدانه یاد دهی پیروی کنم؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Moses said to him: "May I attend upon you that you may instruct me in the knowledge you have been taught of the right way?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Moosa said to him, “May I stay with you upon the condition that you will teach me the righteousness that you have been taught?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Moses said to him, 'Shall I follow thee so that thou teachest me, of what thou hast been taught, right judgment.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Musa said unto him: shall I follow thee that thou mayest teach me of that which thou hast been taught a directive knowledge.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Musa (Moses) said to him (Khidr) "May I follow you so that you teach me something of that knowledge (guidance and true path) which you have been taught (by Allah)?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Moses said to him, “May I follow you, so that you may teach me some of the guidance you were taught?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Moses said to him: "May l follow you that you may teach me something of the wisdom which you have been taught?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Musa said to him: "May I follow you so that you teach me something of that knowledge which you have been taught (by Allah)"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Moses said unto him: May I follow thee, to the end that thou mayst teach me right conduct of that which thou hast been taught?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Moses said to him, ‘May I follow you for the purpose that you teach me some of the probity you have been taught?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Moses said to him: 'May I follow you so that you can teach me of that you have learned of righteousness'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Moses said to him, "May I follow you on [the condition] that you teach me from what you have been taught of sound judgement?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Moses asked him, "Can I follow you so that you would teach me the guidance that you have received?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Musa said to him: Shall I follow you on condition that you should teach me right knowledge of what you have been taught?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala lahu moosa hal attabiAAuka AAala an tuAAallimani mimma AAullimta rushdan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Moses said to him, "May I follow you, so that you may guide me by what you have been taught?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Moses said to him: "May I follow thee, on the footing that thou teach me something of the (Higher) Truth which thou hast been taught?"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ إِنَّکَ‌ لَنْ‌ تَسْتَطِيعَ‌ مَعِيَ‌ صَبْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: [ای موسی!] تو هرگز نمی توانی بر همراهی من شکیبایی ورزی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: تو را شكيب همراهى با من نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: تو هرگز نمى‌توانى همراه من شكيبايى كنى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «تو هرگز نمى‌توانى همپاى من صبر كنى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن عالم پاسخ داد که تو هرگز نمی‌توانی که (تحمل اسرار کرده و) با من صبر پیشه کنی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (خضر) گفت: تو هرگز توان شکیبائی با من را نداری. [[«مَعِیَ»: مصاحبت و همراهی با من.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [خضر] گفت تو هرگز همپای من صبر نتوانی کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «تو هرگز نمی‌توانی با من شکیبایی کنی!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت همانا تو نتوانی با من صبرکردن‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: تو همراه من نتوانى شكيبايى كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «تو هرگز نتوانی همپای من (در این راه) صبر کنی.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He said: "You will not be able to bear with me.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “You will never be able to patiently stay with me.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'Assuredly thou wilt not be able to bear with me patiently.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: verily thou wilt not be able to have with me patience;

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He (Khidr) said: "Verily! You will not be able to have patience with me!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “You will not be able to endure with me.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He answered: "You will surely not be able to bear with me.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Verily, you will not be able to have patience with me!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Lo! thou canst not bear with me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Indeed you cannot have patience with me!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'You will not bear patiently with me' He replied.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "Indeed, with me you will never be able to have patience.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He replied, "You will not be able to have patience with me.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Surely you cannot have patience with me

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala innaka lan tastateeAAa maAAiya sabran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He replied, "You will not be able to bear with me patiently.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (The other) said: "Verily thou wilt not be able to have patience with me!"

verses.text: وَ کَيْفَ‌ تَصْبِرُ عَلَى‌ مَا لَمْ‌ تُحِطْ بِهِ‌ خُبْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و چگونه می توانی بر چیزی که به آن احاطه [علمی] نداری شکیبایی ورزی؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و چگونه در برابر چيزى كه بدان آگاهى نيافته‌اى صبر خواهى كرد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و چگونه مى‌توانى امرى را كه به اسرارش احاطه ندارى تحمّل كنى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چگونه مى‌توانى بر چيزى كه به شناخت آن احاطه ندارى صبر كنى؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و چگونه صبر توانی کرد بر چیزی که از علم آن آگهی کامل نیافته‌ای؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و چگونه می‌توانی در برابر چیزی که از راز و رمز آن آگاه نیستی، شکیبائی کنی؟! [[«خُبْراً»: آگاهی. شناخت. دانش. تمییز است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چگونه درباره چیزی که به آن علم و احاطه نداری، صبر ورزی؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و چگونه می‌توانی در برابر چیزی که از رموزش آگاه نیستی شکیبا باشی؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و چگونه صبر کنی بر آنچه فرانگرفتی بر آن آگاهی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و چگونه بر آنچه بدان آگاهى و دانشى ندارى شكيبايى كنى؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و چگونه می‌توانی بر چیزی که به شناخت آن احاطه‌ای نداری صبر کنی‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "How can you bear that which is beyond your comprehension?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And how will you bear something which your knowledge does not encompass?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And how shouldst thou bear patiently that thou hast never encompassed in thy knowledge?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And how canst thou have patience over that which thy knowledge encompasseth not

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And how can you have patience about a thing which you know not?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And how will you endure what you have no knowledge of?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: For how can you patiently bear with something you cannot encompass in your knowledge?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And how can you have patience about a thing which you know not"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: How canst thou bear with that whereof thou canst not compass any knowledge?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And how can you have patience about something you do not comprehend?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'For how can you bear patiently with that which you have never encompassed in your knowledge'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And how can you have patience for what you do not encompass in knowledge?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: "How can you remain patient with that which you do not fully understand?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And how can you have patience in that of which you have not got a comprehensive knowledge?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wakayfa tasbiru AAala ma lam tuhit bihi khubran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: How could you be patient in matters beyond your knowledge?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "And how canst thou have patience about things about which thy understanding is not complete?"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ سَتَجِدُنِي‌ إِنْ‌ شَاءَ اللَّهُ‌ صَابِراً وَ لاَ أَعْصِي‌ لَکَ‌ أَمْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: اگر خدا بخواهد، مرا شکیبا خواهی یافت، و هیچ فرمانی را از تو مخالفت نخواهم کرد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: اگر خدا بخواهد، مرا صابر خواهى يافت آنچنان كه در هيچ كارى تو را فرمانى نكنم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: اگر خدا خواهد شكيبا خواهى يافت و در هيچ كارى تو را نافرمانى نخواهم كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «ان شاء الله مرا شكيبا خواهى يافت و در هيچ كارى تو را نافرمانى نخواهم كرد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: موسی گفت: به خواست خدا مرا با صبر و تحمل خواهی یافت و هرگز در هیچ امر با تو مخالفت نخواهم کرد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: به خواست خدا، مرا شکیبا خواهی یافت، و (در هیچ کاری) با فرمان تو مخالفت نخواهم کرد. [[«لآ أَعْصِی»: سرکشی و نافرمانی نمی‌کنم. «أَمْراً»: فرمان. کار.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [موسی‌] گفت ان شاء الله مرا شکیبا خواهی یافت، و از امر تو سرپیچی نمی‌کنم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: «به خواست خدا مرا شکیبا خواهی یافت؛ و در هیچ کاری مخالفت فرمان تو نخواهم کرد!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت زود است بیابیم شکیبا اگر خدا خواهد و نافرمانی نکنمت امری را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: اگر خدا خواهد مرا شكيبا خواهى يافت و تو را در هيچ كارى نافرمانى نكنم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «اگر خدا خواهد مرا شکیبا خواهی یافت، و (در) هیچ کاری (که انجام می‌دهی) تو را نافرمانی نخواهم کرد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "You will find me patient if God wills," said Moses; "and I will not disobey you in any thing."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Moosa, “Allah willing, you will soon find me patient and I will not do anything against your instructions.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'Yet thou shalt find me, if God will, patient; and I shall not rebel against thee in anything.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Musa said: thou wilt find me, if Allah will, patient, and shall not disobey thee in any affair.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Musa (Moses) said: "If Allah will, you will find me patient, and I will not disobey you in aught."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “You will find me, God willing, patient; and I will not disobey you in any order of yours.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Moses replied: "You shall find me, if Allah wills, patient; and I shall not disobey you in anything."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Musa said: "If Allah wills, you will find me patient, and I will not disobey you in aught."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Allah willing, thou shalt find me patient and I shall not in aught gainsay thee.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘You will find me, God willing, to be patient, and I will not disobey you in any matter.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (Moses) said: 'If Allah wills, you shall find me patient, I shall not disobey your order'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Moses] said, "You will find me, if Allah wills, patient, and I will not disobey you in [any] order."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Moses said, "If God wishes, you will find me patient and I shall not disobey any of your orders."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: If Allah pleases, you will find me patient and I shall not disobey you in any matter.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala satajidunee in shaa Allahu sabiran wala aAAsee laka amran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Moses said, "God willing, you will find me patient, and I will not disobey you in any thing."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Moses said: "Thou wilt find me, if Allah so will, (truly) patient: nor shall I disobey thee in aught."

verses.text: قَالَ‌ فَإِنِ‌ اتَّبَعْتَنِي‌ فَلاَ تَسْأَلْنِي‌ عَنْ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ حَتَّى‌ أُحْدِثَ‌ لَکَ‌ مِنْهُ‌ ذِکْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: [ای موسی!] اگر دنبال من آمدی، از هیچ چیز از من مپرس تا خودم درباره [حقیقتِ] آن با تو آغاز سخن کنم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: اگر از پى من مى‌آيى، نبايد كه از من چيزى بپرسى تا من خود تو را از آن آگاه كنم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: پس اگر از پى من آمدى، از چيزى سؤال مكن تا خود از آن با تو سخن آغاز كنم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «اگر مرا پيروى مى‌كنى، پس از چيزى سؤال مكن، تا [خود] از آن با تو سخن آغاز كنم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن عالم گفت: پس اگر تابع من شدی دیگر از هر چه من کنم هیچ سؤال مکن تا وقتی که من خود تو را از آن راز آگاه سازم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (خضر) گفت: اگر تو همسفر من شدی (سکوت محض باش و) درباره‌ی چیزی (که انجام می‌دهم و در نظرت ناپسند است) از من مپرس تا خودم راجع بدان برایت سخن بگویم. [[«أُحْدِثَ»: پدیدار می‌کنم. «ذِکْراً»: یاد. بیان. «أُحْدِثَ ... ذِکْراً»: آغاز سخن می‌کنم. به سخن می‌پردازم.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت اگر از من پیروی می‌کنی از هیچ چیز از من سؤال مکن تا آنکه درباره آن با تو سخن بگویم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (خضر) گفت: «پس اگر می‌خواهی بدنبال من بیایی، از هیچ چیز مپرس تا خودم (به موقع) آن را برای تو بازگو کنم.»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت پس اگر پیرویم کردی نپرس مرا از چیزی تا پدید آرم برای تو از آن سخنی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: اگر از من پيروى خواهى كرد، پس مرا از چيزى مپرس تا خود براى تو سخنى از آن پديد آرم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «اگر مرا پیروی می‌کنی، از چیزی مرا مپرس تا (خود) از آن برایت یادی آغاز کنم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "If you must follow me," he said, "do not ask me any thing until I speak of it to you myself."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “Therefore if you stay with me, do not ask me about anything until I myself mention it to you.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'Then if thou followest me, question me not on anything until I myself introduce the mention of it to thee.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: then if thou wilt follow me ask me not of anything until begin thereof some mention.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He (Khidr) said: "Then, if you follow me, ask me not about anything till I myself mention it to you."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “If you follow me, do not ask me about anything, until I myself make mention of it to you.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He said: "Well, if you follow me, do not ask me concerning anything until I myself mention it to you."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Then, if you follow me, ask me not about anything till I myself mention of it to you."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
