translations.text: He said: Well, if thou go with me, ask me not concerning aught till I myself make mention of it unto thee.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘If you follow me, do not question me concerning anything until I myself first mention it for you.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He said: 'If you follow me, you must not question me about anything till I myself speak to you concerning it'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: He said, "Then if you follow me, do not ask me about anything until I make to you about it mention."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He said to Moses, "If you will follow me, do not ask me about anything until I tell you the story about it."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: If you would follow me, then do not question me about any thing until I myself speak to you about it

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala faini ittabaAAtanee fala tasalnee AAan shayin hatta ohditha laka minhu thikran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He said, "Well then, if you would follow me, do not ask me about anything till I speak of it to you."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The other said: "If then thou wouldst follow me, ask me no questions about anything until I myself speak to thee concerning it."

verses.text: فَانْطَلَقَا حَتَّى‌ إِذَا رَکِبَا فِي‌ السَّفِينَةِ خَرَقَهَا قَالَ‌ أَ خَرَقْتَهَا لِتُغْرِقَ‌ أَهْلَهَا لَقَدْ جِئْتَ‌ شَيْئاً إِمْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس هر دو به راه افتادند تا وقتی که در کشتی سوار شدند، او شکافی در کشتی ایجاد کرد. موسی گفت: آیا آن را شکافتی تا سرنشینانش را غرق کنی؟ به راستی که کاری بسیار زشت کردی!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس به راه افتادند تا به كشتى سوار شدند. كشتى را سوراخ كرد. گفت: كشتى را سوراخ مى‌كنى تا مردمش را غرقه سازى؟ كارى كه مى‌كنى كارى سخت بزرگ و زشت است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس به راه افتادند، تا وقتى كه سوار كشتى شدند [خضر] آن را سوراخ كرد. موسى گفت: آيا كشتى را سوراخ كردى تا سرنشينانش را غرق كنى؟ واقعا به كار ناروايى مبادرت كردى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس رهسپار گرديدند، تا وقتى كه سوار كشتى شدند، [وى‌] آن را سوراخ كرد. [موسى‌] گفت: «آيا كشتى را سوراخ كردى تا سرنشينانش را غرق كنى؟ واقعاً به كار ناروايى مبادرت ورزيدى.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: سپس هر دو با هم برفتند تا وقتی که در کشتی سوار شدند. آن عالم کشتی را بشکست، موسی گفت: ای مرد، آیا کشتی شکستی تا اهل آن را به دریا غرق کنی؟! بسیار کار منکر و شگفتی به جای آوردی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس (موسی و خضر با یکدیگر) به راه افتادند (و در ساحل دریا به سفر پرداختند) تا این که سوار کشتی شدند. (خضر در اثنای سفر) آن را سوراخ کرد. (موسی) گفت: آیا کشتی را سوراخ کردی تا سرنشینان آن را غرق کنی؟! واقعاً کار بسیار بدی کردی. [[«إِنطَلَقا»: به راه افتادند. روان شدند. «خَرَقَهَا»: آن را سوراخ کرد. «أَهْلَهَا»: ساکنان آن. صاحبان آن. «إِمْراً»: کار بسیار زشت و شگفت‌انگیز.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس رهسپار شدند تا آنکه سوار کشتی‌ای شدند [و خضر] آن را سوراخ کرد [موسی‌] گفت سوراخش کردی که سرنشینانش را غرق کنی؟ عجب کار هول‌انگیزی کردی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آن دو به راه افتادند؛ تا آن که سوار کشتی شدند، (خضر) کشتی را سوراخ کرد. (موسی) گفت: «آیا آن را سوراخ کردی که اهلش را غرق کنی؟! راستی که چه کار بدی انجام دادی!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس برفتند تا گاهی که سوار شدند در کشتی بشکافتش گفت آیا سوراخ کردیش که غرق کنی مردمش را همانا بیاوردی چیزی زشت را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس برفتند تا آنگاه كه به كشتى سوار شدند، آن را سوراخ كرد. [موسى‌] گفت: آيا آن را سوراخ كردى تا مردمش را غرق كنى؟ بى‌گمان كارى ناروا و شگفت كردى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (از آنجا خستند و) رستند تا وقتی که سوار (آن) کشتی شدند. (وی) آن را درید. (موسی) گفت: «آیا کشتی را دریدی تا سرنشینانش را غرق کنی‌؟ بی‌گمان کاری منکر[:نابسامان و ناروا] به بار آوردی.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So they set out till they (came to the quay) and went on board a ship in which he made a hole, (and Moses said:) "You have made a hole in the boat to drown its passengers? You have done a strange thing!"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they both set out; until when they had boarded the boat, the chosen bondman ruptured the boat; said Moosa, “Did you make a hole in the boat in order to drown its passengers? You have indeed done an evil thing.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So they departed; until, when they embarked upon the ship, he made a hole in it. He said, 'What, hast thou made a hole in it so as to drown its passengers? Thou hast indeed done a grievous thing.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then the twain journeyed until when they embarked in a boat, he scuttled it. Musa said: hast thou scuttled it that thou mayest drown the people thereof? Assuredly thou hast committed a thing grievous.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So they both proceeded, till, when they embarked the ship, he (Khidr) scuttled it. Musa (Moses) said: "Have you scuttled it in order to drown its people? Verily, you have committed a thing "Imra" (a Munkar - evil, bad, dreadful thing)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So they set out. Until, when they had boarded the boat, he holed it. He said, “Did you hole it, to drown its passengers? You have done something awful.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then the two went forth until, when they embarked on the boat, he made a hole in it, whereupon Moses exclaimed: "Have you made a hole in it so as to drown the people in the boat? You have certainly done an awful thing."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So they both proceeded, till, when they boarded the boat, he (Khidr) damaged it. Musa said: "Have you damaged it wherein its people will drown Verily, you have committed a thing Imr."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So they twain set out till, when they were in the ship, he made a hole therein. (Moses) said: Hast thou made a hole therein to drown the folk thereof? Thou verily hast done a dreadful thing.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So they went on and when they boarded the boat, he made a hole in it. He said, ‘Did you make a hole in it to drown its people? You have certainly done a monstrous thing!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So they departed. When they boarded a ship, he bored a hole in it. 'What, have you made a hole in it' he said, 'is it to drown its passengers? You have done a dreadful thing'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So they set out, until when they had embarked on the ship, al-Khidh r tore it open. [Moses] said, "Have you torn it open to drown its people? You have certainly done a grave thing."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They started their journey and some time latter they embarked in a boat in which he made a hole. Moses asked him, "Did you make the hole to drown the people on board? This is certainly very strange".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So they went (their way) until when they embarked in the boat he made a hole in it. (Musa) said: Have you made a hole in it to drown its inmates? Certainly you have done a grievous thing.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faintalaqa hatta itha rakiba fee alssafeenati kharaqaha qala akharaqtaha litughriqa ahlaha laqad jita shayan imran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So they set out, but, when they got into a boat, the man made a hole in it. Moses exclaimed, "Have you made a hole in the boat to drown the people in it? You have indeed done a dreadful thing!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So they both proceeded: until, when they were in the boat, he scuttled it. Said Moses: "Hast thou scuttled it in order to drown those in it? Truly a strange thing hast thou done!"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ أَ لَمْ‌ أَقُلْ‌ إِنَّکَ‌ لَنْ‌ تَسْتَطِيعَ‌ مَعِيَ‌ صَبْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: [ای موسی!] آیا نگفتم که تو هرگز نمی توانی بر همراهی من شکیبایی ورزی؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: نگفتم كه تو را شكيب همراهى با من نيست؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: آيا نگفتم كه تو هرگز نمى‌توانى همراه من شكيبايى كنى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «آيا نگفتم كه تو هرگز نمى‌توانى همپاى من صبر كنى؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: گفت: آیا من نگفتم که هرگز ظرفیت و توانایی آنکه با من صبر کنی نداری؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (خضر) گفت: مگر نگفتم که تو هرگز نمی‌توانی همراه من شکیبائی‌کنی؟

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [خضر] گفت مگر نگفتمت که تو همپای من صبر نتوانی کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفت: «آیا نگفتم تو هرگز نمی‌توانی با من شکیبایی کنی؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت آیا نگفتم که تو نتوانی با من صبرکردن‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: نگفتم كه تو همراه من نتوانى شكيبايى كرد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «آیا نگفتم تو هرگز نتوانی همپای من صبر کنی‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Did I not tell you," he replied, "that you will not be able to bear with me?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “Did I not say that you will never be able to patiently stay with me?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'Did I not say that thou couldst never bear with me patiently?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: said I not that thou wouldst not be able to have with me patience?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: He (Khidr) said: "Did I not tell you, that you would not be able to have patience with me?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Did I not tell you that you will not be able to endure with me?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He replied: "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to patiently bear with me?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Did I not tell you, that you would not be able to have patience with me"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Did I not tell thee that thou couldst not bear with me?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Did I not say that you cannot have patience with me?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Did I not I tell you' he replied, 'that you would not bear patiently with me'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not say that with me you would never be able to have patience?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He said, "Did I not tell you that you would not be able to remain patient with me?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Did I not say that you will not be able to have patience with me?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala alam aqul innaka lan tastateeAAa maAAiya sabran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He replied, "Did I not tell you that you would never be able to bear with me patiently?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no patience with me?"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ لاَ تُؤَاخِذْنِي‌ بِمَا نَسِيتُ‌ وَ لاَ تُرْهِقْنِي‌ مِنْ‌ أَمْرِي‌ عُسْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: مرا بر آنچه از یاد بردم، مؤاخذه مکن و در کارم به من سخت مگیر.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: اگر فراموش كرده‌ام مرا بازخواست مكن و بدين اندازه بر من سخت مگير.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: موسى گفت: به سبب آنچه فراموش كردم مرا مؤاخذه مكن و در كارم بر من سخت مگير

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [موسى‌] گفت: «به سبب آنچه فراموش كردم، مرا مؤاخذه مكن و در كارم بر من سخت مگير.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: موسی گفت: (این یک بار) بر من مگیر که شرط خود را فراموش کردم و مرا تکلیف سخت طاقت فرسا نفرما.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: مرا به خاطر فراموش کردن (توصیه‌ات) بازخواست مکن و در کارم (که یادگیری و پیروی از تو است) بر من سخت مگیر. [[«لا تُرْهِقْنِی»: بر من تحمیل مکن (نگا: کهف / 80). «مِنْ أََمْرِی»: در کارم. مراد کار تعلّم و پیروی موسی از خضر است. «عُسْراً»: سختی. دشواری.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت مرا به خاطر آنچه فراموش کردم مؤاخذه مکن و کار را بر من سخت مگیر

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: «مرا بخاطر این فراموشکاریم مؤاخذه مکن و از این کارم بر من سخت مگیر!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت مرا نگیر بدانچه فراموش کردم و نرسان به من از کارم سختی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: مرا بدانچه فراموش كردم بازخواست مكن و كارم را بر من سخت مگير.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: «به (سبب) آنچه فراموش کردم، مرا مؤاخذه مکن، و از (این) کارم، مرا به سختی مینداز.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: (Moses) said: "Do not hold me for having forgotten, and do not reprove me and make my task difficult."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Moosa, “Do not apprehend me upon my forgetting, and do not impose difficulty on me in my task.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'Do not take me to task that I forgot, neither constrain me to do a thing too difficult.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Musa said: take me not to task for that forget, and impose not in my affair hardship.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "Call me not to account for what I forgot, and be not hard upon me for my affair (with you)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Do not rebuke me for forgetting, and do not make my course difficult for me.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Moses said: "Do not take me to task at my forgetfulness, and do not be hard on me."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Call me not to account for what I forgot, and be not hard upon me for my affair (with you)."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (Moses) said: Be not wroth with me that I forgot, and be not hard upon me for my fault.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Do not take me to task for my forgetting, and do not be hard upon me.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Moses said: 'Do not blame me for what I forgot, nor press me to do something which is too difficult'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Moses said, "Please, forgive my forgetfulness. Do not oblige me with what is difficult for me to endure."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Blame me not for what I forgot, and do not constrain me to a difficult thing in my affair.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala la tuakhithnee bima naseetu wala turhiqnee min amree AAusran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He said, "Do not take me to task for what I have forgotten, and do not be hard on me on account of what I have done!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Moses said: "Rebuke me not for forgetting, nor grieve me by raising difficulties in my case."

verses.text: فَانْطَلَقَا حَتَّى‌ إِذَا لَقِيَا غُلاَماً فَقَتَلَهُ‌ قَالَ‌ أَ قَتَلْتَ‌ نَفْساً زَکِيَّةً بِغَيْرِ نَفْسٍ‌ لَقَدْ جِئْتَ‌ شَيْئاً نُکْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [هر دو] به راه افتادند تا [زمانی که] به نوجوانی برخوردند؛ پس [بنده ما] او را کشت. موسی گفت: آیا شخص بی گناهی را بدون آنکه کسی را کشته باشد، کُشتی؟ به راستی که کاری بسیار ناپسند مرتکب شدی!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و رفتند تا به پسرى رسيدند، او را كشت، موسى گفت: آيا جان پاكى را بى‌آنكه مرتكب قتلى شده باشد مى‌كشى؟ مرتكب كارى زشت گرديدى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس برفتند تا به نوجوانى برخوردند، پس [خضر] او را كشت. موسى گفت: آيا بى‌گناهى را بى‌آن كه كسى را كشته باشد كشتى؟ واقعا كار منكرى مرتكب شدى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس رفتند تا به نوجوانى برخوردند. [بنده ما] او را كشت. [موسى به او ] گفت: «آيا شخص بى‌گناهى را بدون اينكه كسى را به قتل رسانده باشد كشتى؟ واقعاً كار ناپسندى مرتكب شدى.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و باز هم روان شدند تا به پسری برخوردند، او پسر را (بی‌گفتگو) به قتل رسانید. باز موسی گفت: آیا نفس محترمی که کسی را نکشته بود بی‌گناه کشتی؟ همانا کار بسیار منکر و ناپسندی کردی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: به راه خود ادامه دادند تا آن گاه که (از کشتی پیاده شدند و در مسیر خود) به کودکی رسیدند. (خضر) او را کشت! (موسی) گفت: آیا انسان بیگناه و پاکی را کشتی، بدون آن که او کسی را کشته باشد؟! واقعاً کار زشت و ناپسندی کردی. [[«غُلاماً»: نوجوان. در اینجا مراد پسر بچّه و کودک است (نگا: آل‌عمران / 40). «نَفْساً»: انسان. شخص. «زَکِیَّةً»: پاک و بی‌گناه. «بِغَیْرِ نَفْسٍ»: بدون کشتن کسی و داشتن حق قصاص. «نُکْراً»: زشت. نفرت‌انگیز.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: باز رهسپار شدند تا آنکه به جوانی برخوردند و [خضر] او را کشت [موسی‌] گفت آیا انسان بیگناهی را بدون آنکه قصاصی در بین باشد، کشتی، به راستی کار ناپسندیده‌ای کردی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: باز به راه خود ادامه دادند، تا اینکه نوجوانی را دیدند؛ و او آن نوجوان را کشت. (موسی) گفت: «آیا انسان پاکی را، بی آنکه قتلی کرده باشد، کشتی؟! براستی کار زشتی انجام دادی!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس برفتند تا گاهی که به کودکی رسیدند بکشتش گفت آیا کشتی تنی پاک را نه در برابر تنی همانا آوردی چیزی ناپسند را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس روانه شدند تا آنگاه كه نوجوانى را ديدار كردند و او را كشت، [موسى‌] گفت: آيا جان پاكى- بى‌گناهى- را بى‌آنكه كسى را كشته باشد كشتى؟ براستى كارى زشت و ناشايسته كردى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (همچنان خستند و) رستند، تا هنگامی که به نوجوانی برخورد کردند. پس وی او را کشت. (موسی بدو) گفت: «آیا شخص پاکی را- بدون اینکه کسی را به (ناپاکی) کشته باشد- کشتی‌؟ بی‌چون همواره منکری (به بار) آوردی.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The two went on till they came to a boy, whom he killed. Moses exclaimed: "You have killed an innocent soul who had taken no life. You have done a most abominable thing!"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they set out again; until when they met a boy, the chosen bondman slew him – Moosa said, “Did you slay an innocent soul not in retribution for another? You have indeed done an extremely evil thing.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So they departed; until, when they met a lad, he slew him. He said, 'What, hast thou slain a soul innocent, and that not to retaliate for a soul slain? Thou hast indeed done a horrible thing.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then the twain journeyed until when they met a boy, and he killed him. Musa said: hast thou slain a person innocent not in return for a Person Assuredly thou hast committed a thing formidable.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then they both proceeded, till they met a boy, he (Khidr) killed him. Musa (Moses) said: "Have you killed an innocent person who had killed none? Verily, you have committed a thing "Nukra" (a great Munkar - prohibited, evil, dreadful thing)!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then they set out. Until, when they encountered a boy, he killed him. He said, “Did you kill a pure soul, who killed no one? You have done something terrible.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then the two went forth until they met a lad whom he slew, whereupon Moses exclaimed: "What! Have you slain an innocent person without his having slain anyone? Surely you have done a horrible thing."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then they both proceeded till they met a boy, and he (Khidr) killed him. Musa said: "Have you killed an innocent person without Nafs Verily, you have committed a thing Nukr!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So they twain journeyed on till, when they met a lad, he slew him. (Moses) said: What! Hast thou slain an innocent soul who hath slain no man? Verily thou hast done a horrid thing.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So they went on until they came upon a boy, whereat he slew him. He said, ‘Did you slay an innocent soul, without [his having slain] anyone? You have certainly done a dire thing!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and so they departed. Thereafter they met a boy and he killed him. He (Moses) exclaimed: 'What, have you killed a pure soul and it was not done (in retaliation) for a soul you have done a terrible thing'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So they set out, until when they met a boy, al-Khidh r killed him. [Moses] said, "Have you killed a pure soul for other than [having killed] a soul? You have certainly done a deplorable thing."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They continued on their journey until they met a young boy whom he killed. Moses said, "How could you murder an innocent soul? This is certainly a horrible act".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So they went on until, when they met a boy, he slew him. (Musa) said: Have you slain an innocent person otherwise than for manslaughter? Certainly you have done an evil thing.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faintalaqa hatta itha laqiya ghulaman faqatalahu qala aqatalta nafsan zakiyyatan bighayri nafsin laqad jita shayan nukran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So they travelled on. Then they met a young boy and the man killed him. Moses said, "Have you slain an innocent person without his having slain anyone? Indeed, you have done a terrible thing!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then they proceeded: until, when they met a young man, he slew him. Moses said: "Hast thou slain an innocent person who had slain none? Truly a foul (unheard of) thing hast thou done!"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ أَ لَمْ‌ أَقُلْ‌ لَکَ‌ إِنَّکَ‌ لَنْ‌ تَسْتَطِيعَ‌ مَعِيَ‌ صَبْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: [ای موسی!] آیا نگفتم که تو هرگز نمی توانی بر همراهی من شکیبایی کنی؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: نگفتم كه تو را شكيب همراهى با من نيست؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: آيا به تو نگفتم كه هرگز نمى‌توانى همراه من شكيبايى كنى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «آيا به تو نگفتم كه هرگز نمى‌توانى همپاى من صبر كنى؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: گفت: آیا با تو نگفتم که تو هرگز ظرفیت و مقام آنکه با من صبر کنی نخواهی داشت؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (خضر) گفت: مگر به تو نگفتم که تو با من توان شکیبائی را نخواهی داشت؟

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [خضر] گفت مگر نگفتمت که تو همپای من صبر نتوانی کرد؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (باز آن مرد عالم) گفت: «آیا به تو نگفتم که تو هرگز نمی‌توانی با من صبر کنی؟!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت آیا نگفتم به تو که نتوانی هرگز با من صبرکردن‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: آيا تو را نگفتم كه همراه من نتوانى شكيبايى كرد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «آیا به تو نگفتم هرگز نتوانی –همواره-  پایاپای من صبری کنی‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: He said: "Did I not tell you you will not be able to bear with me?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “Did I not tell you that you will never be able to patiently stay with me?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'Did I not say that thou couldst never bear with me patiently?'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: said I not unto thee that thou wouldst by no means be able to have with me patience?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Khidr) said: "Did I not tell you that you can have no patience with me?"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “Did I not tell you that you will not be able to endure with me?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He said: "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to patiently bear with me?"

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "Did I not tell you that you can have no patience with me"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: Did I not tell thee that thou couldst not bear with me?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘Did I not tell you that you cannot have patience with me?’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Did I not tell you' he replied, 'that you would not be able to bear patiently with me'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Al-Khidh r] said, "Did I not tell you that with me you would never be able to have patience?"

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He responded, "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to remain patient with me?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: Did I not say to you that you will not be able to have patience with me?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala alam aqul laka innaka lan tastateeAAa maAAiya sabran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The man said, "Did I not tell you that you would not be able to have any patience with me?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no patience with me?"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ إِنْ‌ سَأَلْتُکَ‌ عَنْ‌ شَيْ‌ءٍ بَعْدَهَا فَلاَ تُصَاحِبْنِي‌ قَدْ بَلَغْتَ‌ مِنْ‌ لَدُنِّي‌ عُذْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: بعد از این اگر چیزی از تو پرسیدم، دیگر با من مصاحبت مکن [برای آنکه] از جانب من به عذر قابل قبولی رسیده ای [و برای جدا شدن از من دلیل قاطعی داری.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: اگر از اين پس از تو چيزى پرسم با من همراهى مكن، كه از جانب من معذور باشى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: موسى گفت: اگر از اين پس چيزى از تو پرسيدم، ديگر با من همراهى نكن و از جانب من البته معذور خواهى بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [موسى‌] گفت: «اگر از اين پس چيزى از تو پرسيدم، ديگر با من همراهى مكن [و] از جانب من قطعاً معذور خواهى بود.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: موسی گفت: اگر بار دیگر از تو مؤاخذه و اعتراضی کردم از آن بعد با من ترک صحبت و رفاقت کن که از (تقصیر) من عذر موجه (بر متارکه دوستی) به دست خواهی داشت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: اگر بعد از این، از تو درباره‌ی چیزی پرسیدم (و اعتراض کردم) با من همدم مشو، چرا که به نظرم معذور خواهی بود (از من جدا شوی). [[«بَعْدَهَا»: بعد از این مرتبه. بعد از این مسأله. «لا تُصَاحِبْنی»: با من مصاحبت و همدمی مکن. «قَدْ بَلَغْتَ مِن لَّدُنِّی عُذْراً»: تو از جانب من معذوری. کار بدانجا رسیده است که عذر مرا بخواهی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفت اگر بعد از این از تو درباره چیزی پرس و جو کردم با من همراهی مکن، که دیگر [در ترکم‌] معذور خواهی بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: «بعد از این اگر درباره چیزی از تو سؤال کردم، دیگر با من همراهی نکن؛ (زیرا) از سوی من معذور خواهی بود!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت اگر پرسیدمت از چیزی پس از این همراهم نگیر به درست رسیدی از نزدم بهانه‌ای را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: اگر از اين پس تو را از چيزى بپرسم با من همراهى مكن، كه از سوى من هر آينه به عذرى رسيده‌اى- در ترك مصاحبت من معذور باشى-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (موسی) گفت: «اگر از این پس چیزی (درباره‌ی آنچه کردی) از تو بپرسم، دیگر با من همراهی مکن. از سوی من بی‌چون به عذری رسیده‌ای.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Moses said: "If I ask you any thing again then do not keep me with you. You have my apology."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Said Moosa, “If I ask you anything after this, do not stay with me; indeed your condition from me is fulfilled.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: He said, 'If I question thee on anything after this, then keep me company no more; thou hast already experienced excuse sufficient on my part.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Musa said: if I ask thee regarding aught after this, company not with me; surely there hath reached to thee from my side an excuse.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: [Musa (Moses)] said: "If I ask you anything after this, keep me not in your company, you have received an excuse from me."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “If I ask you about anything after this, then do not keep company with me. You have received excuses from me.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Moses said: "Keep me no more in your company if I question you concerning anything after this. You will then be fully justified."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "If I ask you anything after this, keep me not in your company, you have received an excuse from me."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: (Moses) said: If I ask thee after this concerning aught, keep not company with me. Thou hast received an excuse from me.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘If I question you about anything after this, do not keep me in your company. You already have enough excuse on my part.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He (Moses) said: 'If I question you again do not let me be your companion; you already have enough excuse'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Moses] said, "If I should ask you about anything after this, then do not keep me as a companion. You have obtained from me an excuse."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Moses said, "If I ask you such questions again, abandon me; you will have enough reason to do so."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: If I ask you about anything after this, keep me not in your company; indeed you shall have (then) found an excuse in my case.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala in saaltuka AAan shayin baAAdaha fala tusahibnee qad balaghta min ladunnee AAuthran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Moses replied, "If I ever ask you about anything after this, do not let me accompany you. I will have given you sufficient excuse."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Moses) said: "If ever I ask thee about anything after this, keep me not in thy company: then wouldst thou have received (full) excuse from my side."

verses.text: فَانْطَلَقَا حَتَّى‌ إِذَا أَتَيَا أَهْلَ‌ قَرْيَةٍ اسْتَطْعَمَا أَهْلَهَا فَأَبَوْا أَنْ‌ يُضَيِّفُوهُمَا فَوَجَدَا فِيهَا جِدَاراً يُرِيدُ أَنْ‌ يَنْقَضَ‌ فَأَقَامَهُ‌ قَالَ‌ لَوْ شِئْتَ‌ لاَتَّخَذْتَ عَلَيْهِ‌ أَجْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [هر دو] به راه افتادند تا هنگامی که به مردم شهری رسیدند، از مردمش خوراک خواستند و آنان از اینکه آن دو را مهمان کنند، خودداری کردند. پس در آن شهر، دیواری یافتند که می خواست فرو ریزد، پس او آن را [به گونه ای] استوار کرد [که فرو نریزد]. موسی گفت: اگر می خواستی برای تعمیر آن دیوار، مزدی می گرفتی [که برای خود خوراک فراهم آوریم.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس برفتند تا به دهى رسيدند. از مردم آن ده طعامى خواستند. از ميزبانيشان سر برتافتند. آنجا ديوارى ديدند كه نزديك بود فرو ريزد. ديوار را راست كرد. موسى گفت: كاش در برابر اين كار مزدى مى‌خواستى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس راه افتادند، تا وقتى كه به مردم قريه‌اى رسيدند، از اهل آن غذا خواستند، ولى آنها از مهمان كردنشان ابا كردند. پس در آن جا ديوارى يافتند كه مى‌خواست فرو ريزد. [خضر] آن را به پا داشت. موسى گفت: اگر مى‌خواستى، براى اين كار مزدى مى‌گرفتى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس رفتند تا به اهل قريه‌اى رسيدند. از مردم آنجا خوراكى خواستند، و[لى آنها] از مهمان نمودن آن دو خوددارى كردند. پس در آنجا ديوارى يافتند كه مى‌خواست فرو ريزد، و [بنده ما] آن را استوار كرد. [موسى‌] گفت: «اگر مى‌خواستى [مى‌توانستى‌] براى آن مزدى بگيرى.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز با هم روان شدند تا وارد بر شهری شدند و از اهل آن شهر طعام خواستند، مردم از طعام دادن و مهمانی آنها ابا کردند (آنها هم از آن شهر به عزم خروج رفتند تا) در (نزدیکی دروازه آن) شهر به دیواری که نزدیک به انهدام بود رسیدند و آن عالم به استحکام و تعمیر آن پرداخت. باز موسی گفت: روا بود که بر این کار اجرتی می‌گرفتی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: باز به راه خود ادامه دادند تا به روستائی رسیدند. از اهالی آنجا غذا خواستند؛ ولی آنان از مهمان کردن آن دو خودداری نمودند. ایشان در میان روستا به دیواری رسیدند که داشت فرو می‌ریخت. (خضر) آن را تعمیر و بازسازی کرد. (موسی) گفت: اگر می‌خواستی می‌توانستی در مقابل این کار مزدی بگیری (و شکممان را بدان سیر کنی. آخر فداکاری با این مردمان فرومایه، حیف است). [[«إِسْتَطْعَمَا»: غذا خواستند. تقاضای خوراک کردند. «جِدَاراً»: دیوار. «یَنقَضَّ»: فرود آید. فرو ریزد. «أَقَامَهُ»: برجایش داشت. آن را تعمیر و مرمّت کرد. «لَتَّخَذْتَ»: این فعل از ماده (تَخَذَ) به معنی (أَخَذَ) و از باب افتعال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: باز رهسپار شدند تا آنکه به اهل شهری رسیدند و از مردمش خوراکی خواستند، آنان از مهمان کردنشان، ابا کردند، سپس دیواری را دیدند که می‌خواست فرو ریزد [خضر] آن را برپا داشت [موسی‌] گفت اگر می‌خواستی برای این کار از آنان مزدی می‌گرفتی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: باز به راه خود ادامه دادند تا به مردم قریه‌ای رسیدند؛ از آنان خواستند که به ایشان غذا دهند؛ ولی آنان از مهمان کردنشان خودداری نمودند؛ (با این حال) در آن جا دیواری یافتند که می‌خواست فروریزد؛ و (آن مرد عالم) آن را برپا داشت. (موسی) گفت: «(لااقل) می‌خواستی در مقابل این کار مزدی بگیری!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس برفتند تا گاهی که رسیدند مردم شهری را خوراک خواستند از مردمش پس خودداری کردند از آنکه مهمانشان کنند پس یافتند در آن دیواری را که می‌خواست فرو ریزد پس بپای داشتش گفت اگر می‌خواستی می‌گرفتی بر این مزدی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس برفتند تا چون به مردم شهرى رسيدند از مردمش طعام خواستند، ولى از مهمان كردن آنها سر باز زدند، آنگاه ديوارى يافتند كه مى‌خواست فروريزد، پس آن را راست كرد، [موسى‌] گفت: اگر مى‌خواستى در برابر اين كار مزدى مى‌گرفتى!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (از اینجا هم خستند و) رستند تا هنگامی که به اهل قریه‌ای رسیدند. از مردم با اهلیَتَش خوراکی خواستند (ولی) آنها از مهمان نمودن آن دو خودداری کردند. پس در آن‌جا دیواری یافتند که می‌خواست فرو ریزد. آن را استوار کرد. (موسی) گفت: «اگر می‌خواستی بی‌چون بر (کارکرد) آن مزدی می‌گرفتی.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The two went on till they came upon some villagers, and asked the people for food, but they refused to entertain them. There they found a wall that was crumbling, which he repaired. Moses remarked: "You could have demanded wages for it if you liked."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they both set out again; until they came to the people of a dwelling – they asked its people for food – they refused to invite them – then in the village they both found a wall about to collapse, and the chosen bondman straightened it; said Moosa, “If you wished, you could have taken some wages for it!”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So they departed; until, when they reached the people of a city, they asked the people for food, but they refused to receive them hospitably. There they found a wall about to tumble down, and so he set it up. He said, 'If thou hadst wished, thou couldst have taken a wage for that.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then the twain journeyed until when they came unto the people of a city, they begged food from the people thereof, but they refused to entertain the twain. Then they found therein a wall, about to fall down, and he set it upright. Musa said: hadst thou willed, thou mightest have taken therefor a hire.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then they both proceeded, till, when they came to the people of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused to entertain them. Then they found therein a wall about to collapse and he (Khidr) set it up straight. [Musa (Moses)] said: If you had wished, surely, you could have taken wages for it!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So they set out. Until, when they reached the people of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. There they found a wall about to collapse, and he repaired it. He said, “If you wanted, you could have obtained a payment for it.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then the two went forth until when they came to a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to play host to them. They found in that town a wall that was on the verge of tumbling down, and he buttressed it, whereupon Moses said: "If you had wished, you could have received payment for it."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then they both proceeded till when they came to the people of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused to entertain them. Then they found therein a wall about to collapse and he set it up straight. (Musa) said: "If you had wished, surely you could have taken wages for it!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So they twain journeyed on till, when they came unto the folk of a certain township, they asked its folk for food, but they refused to make them guests. And they found therein a wall upon the point of falling into ruin, and he repaired it. (Moses) said: If thou hadst wished, thou couldst have taken payment for it.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So they went on until they came to the people of a town. They asked its people for food, but they refused to extend them any hospitality. There they found a wall which was about to collapse, so he erected it. He said, ‘Had you wished, you could have taken a wage for it.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So they departed and thereafter they came to the inhabitants of a village. They asked its inhabitants for some food, but they declined to host them. There, they found a wall about to fall down whereupon his companion restored it. He (Moses) said: 'Had you wished, you could have taken payment for that'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So they set out, until when they came to the people of a town, they asked its people for food, but they refused to offer them hospitality. And they found therein a wall about to collapse, so al-Khidh r restored it. [Moses] said, "If you wished, you could have taken for it a payment."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They continued on their journey again until they reached a town. They asked the people there for food, but no one accepted them as their guests. They found there a wall of a house which was on the verge of tumbling to the ground. The companion of Moses repaired that wall. Moses said, "You should have received some money for your labor."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So they went on until when they came to the people of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused to entertain them as guests. Then they found in it a wall which was on the point of falling, so he put it into a right state. (Musa) said: If you had pleased, you might certainly have taken a recompense for it.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faintalaqa hatta itha ataya ahla qaryatin istatAAama ahlaha faabaw an yudayyifoohuma fawajada feeha jidaran yureedu an yanqadda faaqamahu qala law shita laittakhathta AAalayhi ajran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So they went on until they came to a town. They asked its people for food, but were refused hospitality. They found a wall in the town which was about to fall down. His companion buttressed it and Moses said, "Had you wished, you could have demanded payment for your labours."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then they proceeded: until, when they came to the inhabitants of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused them hospitality. They found there a wall on the point of falling down, but he set it up straight. (Moses) said: "If thou hadst wished, surely thou couldst have exacted some recompense for it!"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ هٰذَا فِرَاقُ‌ بَيْنِي‌ وَ بَيْنِکَ‌ سَأُنَبِّئُکَ‌ بِتَأْوِيلِ‌ مَا لَمْ‌ تَسْتَطِعْ‌ عَلَيْهِ‌ صَبْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفت: [ای موسی!] اکنون زمان جدایی میان من و توست؛ به زودی تو را به تفسیر و علت آنچه نتوانستی بر آن شکیبایی ورزی، آگاه می کنم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفت: اكنون زمان جدايى ميان من و توست و تو را از راز آن كارها كه تحملشان را نداشتى آگاه مى‌كنم:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفت: اين [زمان‌] جدايى ميان من و توست. هم اينك تو را از باطن آنچه كه نتوانستى بر آن صبر كنى خبردار مى‌كنم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفت: «اين [بار، ديگر وقت‌] جدايى ميان من و توست. به زودى تو را از تأويل آنچه كه نتوانستى بر آن صبر كنى آگاه خواهم ساخت»:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن عالم گفت: این (سه بار کم‌ظرفی و بی‌صبری و اعتراض، عذر) مفارقت بین من و توست، من همین ساعت تو را بر اسرار کارهایم که بر فهم آن صبر و ظرفیت نداشتی آگاه می‌سازم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (خضر) گفت: اینک وقت جدائی من و تو است. من تو را از حکمت و راز کارهائی که در برابر آنها نتوانستی‌شکیبائی کنی آگاه می‌سازم. [[«فِرَاقُ»: جدائی. از یکدیگر جدا شدن و دور گشتن. «تَأْوِیلِ»: تبیین و توجیه. بیان حکمت و راز کار.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [خضر] گفت اینجا دیگر [هنگام‌] جدایی من و توست، هم‌اکنون تو را از معنای آنچه بر آن صبر نتوانستی کرد، آگاه می‌سازم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: او گفت: «اینک زمان جدایی من و تو فرا رسیده؛ اما بزودی راز آنچه را که نتوانستی در برابر آن صبر کنی، به تو خبر می‌دهم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت این است جدائی میان من و تو بزودی آگهیت دهم به سرانجام آنچه نتوانستی بر آن صبرکردن را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفت: اينك جدايى ميان من و توست. اكنون تو را به معنى و فرجام آنچه بر آن نتوانستى شكيبايى كرد آگاه مى‌كنم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفت: «این (بار، دیگر وقت) جدایی میان من و تو است. تو را از تأویل [:دستاورد حقیقی و پنهان] آنچه که نتوانستی بر آن صبری کنی آگاهی مهمی خواهم داد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "This is the parting of our "ways," he said. "But I will now explain the things you could not bear:

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He said, “This is the parting between you and me; I shall now tell you the interpretation of the matters you could not patiently bear.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said he, 'This is the parting between me and thee. Now I will tell thee the interpretation of that thou couldst not bear patiently.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He said: this shall be the parting between me and thee; now I shall declare unto thee the interpretation of that wherewith thou wast not able to have patience.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Khidr) said: "This is the parting between me and you, I will tell you the interpretation of (those) things over which you were unable to hold patience.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He said, “This is the parting between you and me. I will tell you the interpretation of what you were unable to endure.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: He said: "This brings me and you to a parting of ways. Now I shall explain to you the true meaning of things about which you could not remain patient.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: He said: "This is the parting between you and I, I will tell you the interpretation of (those) things over which you were not able to be patient."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: He said: This is the parting between thee and me! I will announce unto thee the interpretation of that thou couldst not bear with patience.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘This is where you and I shall part. I will inform you about the interpretation of that over which you could not maintain patience.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He said: 'This is the parting between me and you. But now I will tell you the interpretation of that which you could not patiently bear.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Al-Khidh r] said, "This is parting between me and you. I will inform you of the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He replied, "This is where we should depart from one another. I shall give an explanation to you for all that I have done for which you could not remain patient.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: This shall be separation between me and you; now I will inform you of the significance of that with which you could not have patience.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala hatha firaqu baynee wabaynika saonabbioka bitaweeli ma lam tastatiAA AAalayhi sabran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He answered, "This is where you and I must part company. But first I will tell you the meaning of the things you could not bear with patiently.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He answered: "This is the parting between me and thee: now will I tell thee the interpretation of (those things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience.

verses.text: أَمَّا السَّفِينَةُ فَکَانَتْ‌ لِمَسَاکِينَ‌ يَعْمَلُونَ‌ فِي‌ الْبَحْرِ فَأَرَدْتُ‌ أَنْ‌ أَعِيبَهَا وَ کَانَ‌ وَرَاءَهُمْ‌ مَلِکٌ‌ يَأْخُذُ کُلَ‌ سَفِينَةٍ غَصْباً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اما آن کشتی، از بی نوایانی بود که [با آن] در دریا کار می کردند و در برابرشان پادشاهی بود که هر کشتی سالم و بی عیبی را غاصبانه تصرف می کرد، من خواستم معیوبش کنم [تا به دست آن ستم گر نیفتد.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما آن كشتى از آنِ بينوايانى بود كه در دريا كار مى‌كردند. خواستم معيوبش كنم، زيرا در آن سوترشان پادشاهى بود كه كشتيها را به غصب مى‌گرفت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اما آن كشتى، مال بينوايانى بود كه [با آن‌] در دريا كار مى‌كردند، پس خواستم آن را معيوب كنم، چون پشت سرشان پادشاهى بود كه هر كشتى [سالمى‌] را به زور مى‌گرفت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اما كشتى، از آنِ بينوايانى بود كه در دريا كار مى‌كردند، خواستم آن را معيوب كنم، [چرا كه‌] پيشاپيش آنان پادشاهى بود كه هر كشتى [درستى‌] را به زور مى‌گرفت.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اما آن کشتی، صاحبش خانواده فقیری بود که در دریا کار می‌کردند (و از آن کشتی کسب و ارتزاق می‌نمودند) خواستم چون کشتی‌ها (ی بی‌عیب) را پادشاه در سر راه به غصب می‌گرفت این کشتی را ناقص کنم (تا برای آن فقیران باقی بماند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و امّا آن کشتی متعلّق به گروهی از مستمندان بود که (با آن) در دریا کار می‌کردند و من خواستم آن را معیوب کنم (و موقّتاً از کار بیفتد چرا که) سر راه آنان پادشاه ستمگری بود که همه‌ی کشتیها (ی سالم) را غصب می‌کرد و می‌برد. [[«السَّفِینَةُ»: کشتی. «مَسَاکِینَ»: کسانی که درآمد و دارائی ایشان جوابگوی نیازهای آنان نباشد. شاید هم مراد کسانی باشد که نسبت به دیگران از نظر قدرت ضعیف و ناتوان باشند. «وَرَآءَ»: پشت سر. جلو و سر راه (نگا: ابراهیم / 16). «غَصْباً»: مفعول مطلق، یا این که تأویل به مشتقّ می‌گردد و حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اما کشتی متعلق به بینوایانی بود که خود [یا برای آنان‌] در دریا کار می‌کردند، پس خواستم آن را عیب‌ناک کنم، و پادشاهی در پیشاروی آنان بود که هر کشتی [سالمی‌] را به زور می‌گرفت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اما آن کشتی مال گروهی از مستمندان بود که با آن در دریا کار می‌کردند؛ و من خواستم آن را معیوب کنم؛ (چرا که) پشت سرشان پادشاهی (ستمگر) بود که هر کشتی (سالمی) را بزور میگرفت!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: اما کشتی پس از آنِ بینوایانی بود که کار می‌کردند در دریا خواستم آسیبی بدان رسانم و بود پشت سر ایشان پادشاهی که می‌گرفت هر کشتی را به ستم (بیگاری)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اما آن كشتى از آن بينوايانى بود كه در دريا كار مى‌كردند. خواستم كه آن را معيوب كنم زيرا در پيش راهشان پادشاهى بود كه هر كشتى را به ناروا و ستم مى‌گرفت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «اما کشتی؛ از بینوایانی بود که در دریا کار می‌کردند، پس خواستم آن را معیوب کنم. حال آنکه از پشت آنان پادشاهی بود که هر کشتی (سالمی) را به زور می‌گرفت.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That boat belonged to poor people who used to toil on the sea. I damaged it because there was a king after them who used to seize every ship by force.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “In respect of the boat – it belonged to the poor people who worked on the river, so I wished to flaw it – and behind them was a king who would capture every sound ship.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: As for the ship, it belonged to certain poor men, who toiled upon the sea; and I desired to damage it, for behind them there was a king who was seizing every ship by brutal force.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: As for the boat, it belonged to poor men working in the sea, so I intended to damage it, for there was before them a prince taking every boat by force.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "As for the ship, it belonged to Masakin (poor people) working in the sea. So I wished to make a defective damage in it, as there was a king after them who seized every ship by force.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As for the boat, it belonged to paupers working at sea. I wanted to damage it because there was a king coming after them seizing every boat by force.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: As for the boat it belonged to some poor people who worked on the river, and I desired to damage it for beyond them lay the dominion of a king who was wont to seize every boat by force.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "As for the boat, it belonged to poor people working in the sea. So I wished to make a defective damage in it, as there was a king behind them who seized every boat by force."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working on the river, and I wished to mar it, for there was a king behind them who is taking every ship by force.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: As for the boat, it belonged to some poor people who work on the sea. I wanted to make it defective, for behind them was a king seizing every ship usurpingly.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working on the sea. I rendered it imperfect because behind them there was a king who was taking every ship by brutal force.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: "The boat belonged to some destitute people who were using it as a means of their living in the sea. The king had imposed a certain amount of tax on every undamaged boat. I damaged it so that they would not have to pay the tax.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: As for the boat, it belonged to (some) poor men who worked on the river and I wished that I should damage it, and there was behind them a king who seized every boat by force.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Amma alssafeenatu fakanat limasakeena yaAAmaloona fee albahri faaradtu an aAAeebaha wakana waraahum malikun yakhuthu kulla safeenatin ghasban

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "The boat belonged to some poor people who made their living from the sea. I wanted to damage it because there was a king coming behind them who was seizing every boat by force.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "As for the boat, it belonged to certain men in dire want: they plied on the water: I but wished to render it unserviceable, for there was after them a certain king who seized on every boat by force.

verses.text: وَ أَمَّا الْغُلاَمُ‌ فَکَانَ‌ أَبَوَاهُ‌ مُؤْمِنَيْنِ‌ فَخَشِينَا أَنْ‌ يُرْهِقَهُمَا طُغْيَاناً وَ کُفْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اما [آن] نوجوان [که او را کُشتم]، پدر و مادرش مؤمن بودند، پس ترسیدم که آن دو را [در آینده] به طغیان و کفر بکشاند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما آن پسر، پدر و مادرش مؤمن بودند. ترسيديم كه آن دو را به عصيان و كفر دراندازد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اما آن نوجوان، پدر و مادرش هر دو مؤمن بودند، پس ترسيديم مبادا آن دو را به طغيان و كفر بكشاند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اما نوجوان، پدر و مادرش [هر دو] مؤمن بودند، پس ترسيديم [مبادا] آن دو را به طغيان و كفر بكِشد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اما آن پسر (کافر بود و) پدر و مادر او مؤمن بودند، از آن باک داشتیم که آن پسر آنها را به خوی کفر و طغیان خود درآورد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و امّا آن کودک (که او را کشتم) پدر و مادرش باایمان بودند (و اگر زنده می‌ماند) می‌ترسیدیم که سرکشی و کفر را بدانان تحمیل کند (و ایشان را از راه ببرد). [[«یُرْهِقَهُمَا»: بر ایشان تحمیل کند. به طغیان و کفرشان کشاند (نگا: کهف / 73).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اما آن جوان، پدر و مادرش مؤمن بودند و ما بیمناک شدیم که مبادا کفر و طغیانی بر آنان تحمیل کند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اما آن نوجوان، پدر و مادرش با ایمان بودند؛ و بیم داشتیم که آنان را به طغیان و کفر وادارد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و امّا کودک بودند پدر و مادرش مؤمنان پس ترسیدیم که واداردشان (یا تنگ آوردشان) به سرکشی و ناسپاسی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اما آن نوجوان، پدر و مادرش مؤمن بودند، پس ترسيديم كه آنان را به سركشى و كفر وادارد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و اما (آن) نوجوان؛ پدر و مادرش مؤمن بودند، پس ترسیدیم (مبادا) آن دو را ناخواسته و به‌ناچار به طغیان و کفر بکشد. »

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: As for the boy, his parents were believers, but we feared that he would harass them with defiance and disbelief.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And in respect of the boy – his parents were Muslims and we feared that he may incite them to rebellion and disbelief.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: As for the lad, his parents were believers; and we were afraid he would impose on them insolence and unbelief;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we apprehended that he might impose upon the twain exorbitance and infidelity.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared lest he should oppress them by rebellion and disbelief.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared he would overwhelm them with oppression and disbelief.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: As for the lad, his parents were people of faith, and we feared lest he should plague them with transgression and disbelief,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared he would oppress them by rebellion and disbelief."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And as for the lad, his parents were believers and we feared lest he should oppress them by rebellion and disbelief.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: As for the boy, his parents were faithful [persons], and We feared he would overwhelm them with rebellion and unfaith.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As for the boy, his parents are believers, and we were afraid lest he should impose on them with his insolence and disbelief.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: "The young boy had very faithful parents. We were afraid that out of love for him they would lose their faith in God and commit rebellion

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And as for the boy, his parents were believers and we feared lest he should make disobedience and ingratitude to come upon them:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waamma alghulamu fakana abawahu muminayni fakhasheena an yurhiqahuma tughyanan wakufran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: As for the youth, his parents were believers and we feared that he would trouble them by rebellion and denial of truth.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "As for the youth, his parents were people of Faith, and we feared that he would grieve them by obstinate rebellion and ingratitude (to Allah and man).

verses.text: فَأَرَدْنَا أَنْ‌ يُبْدِلَهُمَا رَبُّهُمَا خَيْراً مِنْهُ‌ زَکَاةً وَ أَقْرَبَ‌ رُحْماً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس خواستیم پروردگارشان پاک تر و مهربان تر از او را به آنان عوض دهد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خواستيم تا در عوض او پروردگارشان چيزى نصيبشان سازد به پاكى بهتر از او و به مهربانى نزديك‌تر از او.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس خواستيم كه پروردگارشان آن دو را به پاك‌تر و مهربان‌تر از او عوض دهد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس خواستيم كه پروردگارشان آن دو را به پاكتر و مهربانتر از او عوض دهد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: خواستیم تا به جای او خدایشان فرزندی بهتر و صالح‌تر و مهذب‌تر و نزدیکتر به ارحام پرستی به آن پدر و مادر بخشد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما خواستیم که پروردگارشان به جای او فرزند پاکتر و پرمحبّت‌تری بدیشان عطاء فرماید. [[«أَن یُبْدِلَهُمَا»: عوضشان بدهد. «زَکَاةً»: پاکی و پاکیزگی. صلاح و طهارت ذات.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و خواستیم که پروردگارشان به جای او برای ایشان فرزندی پاکنهادتر و مهربان‌تر جانشین گرداند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: از این رو، خواستیم که پروردگارشان به جای او، فرزندی پاکتر و با محبت‌تر به آن دو بدهد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس خواستیم تا بازدهد ایشان را پروردگارشان به جای او بهتر از او را به پاکی و نزدیکتر به رحم‌آوردن‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: از اين رو خواستيم تا پروردگارشان به جايش آن دهدشان كه به پاكى بهتر از او و به مهربانى- يا: رعايت خويشاوندى- نزديكتر از وى باشد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پس خواستیم که پروردگارشان آن دو را به پاکیزه‌تر و رحمت‌وارتر از او عوض دهد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We hoped their Lord would give them a substitute better than him in virtue and goodness.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “So we wished that their Lord may bestow them a child – better, purer and nearer to mercy.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: so we desired that their Lord should give to them in exchange one better than he in purity, and nearer in tenderness.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So we intended that their Lord should change for the twain one better than he in piety and closer in affection.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "So we intended that their Lord should change him for them for one better in righteousness and near to mercy.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So we wanted their Lord to replace him with someone better in purity, and closer to mercy.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and we desired that their Lord should grant them another in his place, a son more upright and more tender hearted.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "So we intended that their Lord should exchange him for them for one better in righteousness and nearer to mercy."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And we intended that their Lord should change him for them for one better in purity and nearer to mercy.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So We desired that their Lord should give them in exchange one better than him in respect of purity and closer in mercy.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It was our wish that their Lord should grant them another in exchange, another better in purity and tenderness.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: so We decided that their Lord should replace him by a better and more virtuous son.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So we desired that their Lord might give them in his place one better than him in purity and nearer to having compassion.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faaradna an yubdilahuma rabbuhuma khayran minhu zakatan waaqraba ruhman

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We wanted their Lord to replace him with someone purer than him and more compassionate.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "So we desired that their Lord would give them in exchange (a son) better in purity (of conduct) and closer in affection.

verses.text: وَ أَمَّا الْجِدَارُ فَکَانَ‌ لِغُلاَمَيْنِ‌ يَتِيمَيْنِ‌ فِي‌ الْمَدِينَةِ وَ کَانَ‌ تَحْتَهُ‌ کَنْزٌ لَهُمَا وَ کَانَ‌ أَبُوهُمَا صَالِحاً فَأَرَادَ رَبُّکَ‌ أَنْ‌ يَبْلُغَا أَشُدَّهُمَا وَ يَسْتَخْرِجَا کَنْزَهُمَا رَحْمَةً مِنْ‌ رَبِّکَ‌ وَ مَا فَعَلْتُهُ‌ عَنْ‌ أَمْرِي‌ ذٰلِکَ‌ تَأْوِيلُ‌ مَا لَمْ‌ تَسْطِعْ‌ عَلَيْهِ‌ صَبْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و اما آن دیوار از دو نوجوان یتیم در این شهر بود، و زیرش گنجی متعلق به آن دو قرار داشت، و پدرشان مردی شایسته بود، پس پروردگارت خواست که آن دو یتیم به حد رشد رسند وگنجشان را به سبب مِهر [ی که] پروردگارت [به آن دو] داشت بیرون آورند؛ و من این را از پیش خود انجام ندادم. این است تفسیر و علت آنچه نتوانستی بر آن شکیبایی ورزی.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما ديوار از آنِ دو پسر يتيم از مردم اين شهر بود. در زيرش گنجى بود، از آنِ پسران، پدرشان مردى صالح بود. پروردگار تو مى‌خواست آن دو به حد رشد رسند و گنج خود را بيرون آرند. و من اين كار را به ميل خود نكردم. رحمت پروردگارت بود. اين است راز آن سخن كه گفتم: تو را شكيب آن نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و اما آن ديوار از آن دو پسر بچه يتيم در آن شهر بود، و زير آن گنجى براى آن دو وجود داشت، و پدرشان مردى شايسته بود، پس پروردگار تو خواست آن دو يتيم به حدّ رشد برسند و گنج خويش را بيرون آورند، كه رحمتى بود از پروردگار تو. و اين كارها را از پيش خود نكردم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و اما ديوار، از آنِ دو پسر [بچه‌] يتيم در آن شهر بود، و زير آن، گنجى متعلق به آن دو بود، و پدرشان [مردى‌] نيكوكار بود، پس پروردگار تو خواست آن دو [يتيم‌] به حد رشد برسند و گنجينه خود را -كه رحمتى از جانب پروردگارت بود- بيرون آورند. و اين [كارها] را من خودسرانه انجام ندادم. اين بود تأويل آنچه كه نتوانستى بر آن شكيبايى ورزى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و اما آن دیوار از آن دو طفل یتیمی در آن شهر بود که پدری صالح داشتند و زیر آن گنجی برای آن دو نهفته بود، خدایت خواست تا به لطف خود آن اطفال به حد رشد رسند و خودشان گنج را استخراج کنند. و من این کارها نه از پیش خود (بلکه به امر خدا) کردم. این است مآل و باطن کارهایی که تو طاقت و ظرفیت بر انجام آن نداشتی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و امّا آن دیوار (که آن را بدون مزد تعمیر کردم) متعلّق به دو کودک یتیم در شهر بود و زیر دیوار گنجی وجود داشت که مال ایشان بود و پدرشان مرد صالح و پارسائی بود (و آن را برایشان پنهان کرده بود). پس پروردگار تو خواست که آن دو کودک به حدّ بلوغ برسند و گنج خود را به مرحمت پروردگارت بیرون بیاورند (و مردمان بدانند که: صلاح پدران و مادران برای پسران و دختران، و خوبی اصول برای فروع سودمند است). من به دستور خود این کارها را نکرده‌ام (و خودسرانه دست به چیزی نبرده‌ام و بلکه فرمان خدا را اجرا نموده‌ام و برابر رهنمود او رفته‌ام). این بود راز و رمز کارهائی که توانائی شکیبائی در برابر آنها را نداشتی. [[«کَنزٌ»: گنج. «رَحْمَةً»: مفعول‌له است برای (أَرَادَ). «تَأوِیلُ»: تفسیر و توجیه (نگا: کهف / 78). «عَنْ أَمْرِی»: به دستور خویش. خودسرانه.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و اما دیوار متعلق به دو جوان یتیم در آن شهر بود و زیر آن گنجی از آن ایشان بود و پدرشان مردی صالح بود، و پروردگارت خواست که آنان به کمال بلوغشان برسند و آنگاه گنجشان را [از آنجا] بیرون آوردند، که رحمتی از پروردگارت [در حق آنان‌] بود، و من آن کار را از پیش خود نکردم، این معنای چیزی است که نتوانستی بر آن صبر کنی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اما آن دیوار، از آن دو نوجوان یتیم در آن شهر بود؛ و زیر آن، گنجی متعلق به آن دو وجود داشت؛ و پدرشان مرد صالحی بود؛ و پروردگار تو می‌خواست آنها به حد بلوغ برسند و گنجشان را استخراج کنند؛ این رحمتی از پروردگارت بود؛ و من آن (کارها) را خودسرانه انجام ندادم؛ این بود راز کارهایی که نتوانستی در برابر آنها شکیبایی به خرج دهی!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و اما دیوار پس از آن دو کودک یتیم بود در شهر و بود زیر آن گنجی از برای ایشان و بود پدر ایشان شایسته پس خواست پروردگار تو که برسند نیروی (جوانی) خود را و برون آرند گنج خویش را مهربانیی از پروردگار تو و من نکردمش به فرمان خود این است سرانجام آنچه نتوانستی بر آن صبرکردن را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و اما آن ديوار از آن دو پسر يتيم در آن شهر بود و زير آن گنجى براى آنان بود و پدرشان مردى نيك بود، پروردگار تو خواست كه آنها به نيرو و جوانى خود برسند و گنج خويش را بيرون آورند، از روى مِهر و بخشايشى از پروردگار تو، و من آن را از پيش خود نكردم. اين است تأويل- توضيح و تبيين حقيقت و راز و سرانجام- آنچه نتوانستى بر آن شكيبايى كرد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «و اما دیوار؛ پس از آنِ دو پسر (بچه‌ی) یتیم در آن شهر بود و زیر آن، گنجی متعلق به آن دو بود و پدرشان (مردی) شایسته بود. پس پروردگارت خواست آن دو (یتیم) به حدّ رشدهاشان رسند و گنجینه‌ی خود را – به رحمت پروردگارت – با کاوش بیرون آورند. و این (کارها) را من خودسرانه انجام ندادم. این بود تأویل آنچه که نتوانستی بر آن شکیبایی ورزی.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: As for that wall, it belonged to two orphan boys of the city, and their treasure was buried under it. Their father was an upright man. So your Lord willed that on reaching the age of maturity they should dig out their treasure as a favour from their Lord. So, I did not do that of my own accord. This is the explanation of things you could not bear with patience."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “And in respect of the wall – it belonged to two orphan boys of the city, and beneath it was their treasure, and their father was a virtuous man; therefore your Lord willed that they should reach their maturity and remove their treasure; by the mercy of your Lord; and I have not done this at my own command; this is the interpretation of the matters you could not patiently bear.” (* Hazrat Khidr was given the knowledge of the hidden – as in all three explanations he gave).

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: As for the wall, it belonged to two orphan lads in the city, and under it was a treasure belonging to them. Their father was a righteous man; and thy Lord desired that they should come of age and then bring forth their treasure as a mercy from thy Lord. I did it not of my own bidding. This is the interpretation of that thou couldst not bear patiently.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the town and underneath it was a treasure belonging to them and their father had been righteous. So thy Lord intended that the twain should attain their maturity and bring forth for themselves their treasure as a mercy from thy Lord. And I did it not of mine own command; that is the interpretation of that wherewith thou wast not able to have patience.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the town; and there was under it a treasure belonging to them; and their father was a righteous man, and your Lord intended that they should attain their age of full strength and take out their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of those (things) over which you could not hold patience."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphaned boys in the town. Beneath it was a treasure that belonged to them. Their father was a righteous man. Your Lord wanted them to reach their maturity, and then extract their treasure—as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do it of my own accord. This is the interpretation of what you were unable to endure.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: As for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and under it there was a treasure that belonged to them. Their father was a righteous man and your Lord intended that they should come of age and then bring forth their treasure as a mercy from your Lord; I did not do this of my own bidding. This is the true meaning of things with which you could not keep your patience."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the town; and there was under it a treasure belonging to them; and their father was a righteous man, and your Lord intended that they should attain their age of full strength and take out their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. And I did them not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of those (things) over which you could not be patient.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure belonging to them, and their father had been righteous, and thy Lord intended that they should come to their full strength and should bring forth their treasure as a mercy from their Lord; and I did it not upon my own command. Such is the interpretation of that wherewith thou couldst not bear.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: As for the wall, it belonged to two boy orphans in the city. Under it there was a treasure belonging to them. Their father had been a righteous man. So your Lord desired that they should come of age and take out their treasure—as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do that out of my own accord. This is the interpretation of that over which you could not maintain patience.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: As for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city. Beneath it was (buried) a treasure which belonged to them. Their father had been a righteous person and your Lord willed that when they reach manhood to bring out their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. What I did was not done by my own command. That is the interpretation of what you could not bear with patience'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure for them, and their father had been righteous. So your Lord intended that they reach maturity and extract their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. And I did it not of my own accord. That is the interpretation of that about which you could not have patience."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: "The tumbling wall belonged to two orphans in the town whose father was a righteous person. Underneath the wall there was a treasure that belonged to them. Your Lord wanted the orphans to find the treasure through the mercy of your Lord when they mature. I did not repair the wall out of my own desire. These were the explanations of my deeds about which you could not remain patient."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure belonging to them, and their father was a righteous man; so your Lord desired that they should attain their maturity and take out their treasure, a mercy from your Lord, and I did not do it of my own accord. This is the significance of that with which you could not have patience.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waamma aljidaru fakana lighulamayni yateemayni fee almadeenati wakana tahtahu kanzun lahuma wakana aboohuma salihan faarada rabbuka an yablugha ashuddahuma wayastakhrija kanzahuma rahmatan min rabbika wama faAAaltuhu AAan amree thalika taweelu ma lam tastiAA AAalayhi sabran

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "The wall belonged to two young orphans in the town whose father had been a righteous man, and a treasure of theirs lay underneath it. So your Lord wanted them to come of age and then to dig up their treasure as a mercy from Him. I did not do [it] of my own accord. That is the explanation of the things about which you were not able to restrain yourself."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "As for the wall, it belonged to two youths, orphans, in the Town; there was, beneath it, a buried treasure, to which they were entitled: their father had been a righteous man: So thy Lord desired that they should attain their age of full strength and get out their treasure - a mercy (and favour) from thy Lord. I did it not of my own accord. Such is the interpretation of (those things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience."

verses.text: وَ يَسْأَلُونَکَ‌ عَنْ‌ ذِي‌ الْقَرْنَيْنِ‌ قُلْ‌ سَأَتْلُو عَلَيْکُمْ‌ مِنْهُ‌ ذِکْراً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و از تو درباره ذوالقرنین می پرسند؛ بگو: به زودی بخشی از سرگذشت او را [به وسیله آیاتی از قرآن] برای شما می خوانم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و از تو در باره ذوالقرنين مى‌پرسند. بگو: براى شما از او چيزى مى‌خوانم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از تو در باره‌ى ذو القرنين مى‌پرسند. بگو: به زودى خبرى از او براى شما خواهم خواند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از تو در باره «ذوالقرنين» مى‌پرسند. بگو: «به زودى چيزى از او براى شما خواهم خواند.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و از تو (ای رسول) سؤال از ذوالقرنین می‌کنند، پاسخ ده که من به زودی حکایتی از او بر شما خواهم خواند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای پیغمبر! برخی از کفّار به دسیسه‌ی یهودیان) از تو درباره‌ی (سرگذشت) ذوالقرنین می‌پرسند. بگو: گوشه‌ای از سرگذشت او را برایتان بازگو خواهم کرد. [[«ذِی الٌقَرْنَیْنِ»: ذوالقرنین را اسکندر مقدونی و کورش کبیر و شاهی از پادشاهان یمن که تبابعه نامیده می‌شدند می‌دانند. علّت تسمیه او به ذوالقرنین شاید این باشد که مشرق و مغرب جهان آن روزی را تسخیر نمود و عربها به آن «قَرْنَیِ الشَّمْسِ»: یعنی دو شاخ خورشید می‌گویند. یا بدین علّت بوده است که کلاهخودی بر سر نهاده است که دو شاخک داشته است. «سَأَتْلُو»: خواهم خواند. بیان خواهم کرد. در رسم‌الخطّ قرآنی الف زائدی در آخر دارد. «ذِکْراً»: یادی. شمّه‌ای (نگا: کهف / 70).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از تو درباره ذوالقرنین می‌پرسند، بگو هم‌اکنون یادی از او برای شما می‌خوانم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از تو درباره «ذو القرنین» می‌پرسند؛ بگو: «بزودی بخشی از سرگذشت او را برای شما بازگو خواهم کرد.»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و پرسندت از ذوالقرنین بگو زود است بخوانم بر شما از او سخنی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و تو را از ذو القرنين پرسند، بگو: اينك از وى خبرى و سخنى بر شما مى‌خوانم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و از تو درباره‌ی ذوالقرنین می‌پرسند. بگو: «از او برای شما یادی خواهم نمود.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They ask you about Dhu'l-Qarnain.
