translations.text: He said: This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord cometh to pass, He will lay it low, for the promise of my Lord is true.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He said, ‘This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord is fulfilled, He will level it; and my Lord’s promise is true.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: He said: 'This is a mercy from my Lord. But when my Lord's promise is come, He will make it dust. The promise of my Lord is true'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Dhul-Qarnayn] said, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes, He will make it level, and ever is the promise of my Lord true."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Dhu l-Qarnayn said, "This barrier is a blessing from my Lord but when His promise comes to pass He will level it to the ground; His promise always comes true."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: He said: This is a mercy from my Lord, but when the promise of my Lord comes to pass He will make it level with the ground, and the promise of my Lord is ever true.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala hatha rahmatun min rabbee faitha jaa waAAdu rabbee jaAAalahu dakkaa wakana waAAdu rabbee haqqan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: and he said, "This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will level it to dust. My Lord's promise is ever true!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: He said: "This is a mercy from my Lord: But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will make it into dust; and the promise of my Lord is true."

verses.text: وَ تَرَکْنَا بَعْضَهُمْ‌ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَمُوجُ‌ فِي‌ بَعْضٍ‌ وَ نُفِخَ‌ فِي‌ الصُّورِ فَجَمَعْنَاهُمْ‌ جَمْعاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و در آن روز که برخی با برخی دیگر درهم و مخلوط، موج می زنند، رهایشان می کنیم و در صور دمیده شود، پس همه آنان را [در عرصه قیامت] گرد می آوریم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و در آن روز واگذاريم تا چون موج روان گردند، و چون در صور دميده شود همه را يكجا گرد آوريم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و در آن روز آنها را چنان رها كنيم كه در يكديگر موج زنند، و همين كه در صور دميده شد آنها را چنان كه بايد جمع مى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و در آن روز آنان را رها مى‌كنيم تا موج‌آسا بعضى با برخى درآميزند و [همين كه‌] در صور دميده شود، همه آنها را گرد خواهيم آورد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و روز آن وعده که فرا رسد (طایفه یأجوج و مأجوج یا) همه خلایق محشر چون موج مضطرب و سرگردان باشند و درهم آمیزند، و نفخه صور دمیده شود و همه خلق را در صحرای قیامت جمع آریم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در آن روز (که جهان پایان می‌گیرد و وعده‌ی آخرت فرا می‌رسد) ما آنان را رها می‌سازیم تا برخی در برخی (فرو لولند و در همدیگر) موج زنند، و (آن گاه برای دومین بار) در صور دمیده می‌شود، و ما ایشان را به گونه‌ی شگفتی (برای حساب و کتاب در یکجا) گرد می‌آوریم. [[«یَوْمَئِذِ»: آن روز که برای بار اوّل در صور دمیده می‌شود و قیامت فرا می‌رسد (نگا: حاقّه / 13). «نُفِخَ فِی الصُّورِ»: مراد دمیدن در صور برای بار دوم است (نگا: زمر / 68). «صُور»: بوق. شیپور (نگا: انعام / 73). «جَمْعاً»: گردآوردن عجیب و غریبی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و آن روز آنان را رها کنیم که در هم و برهم شوند، [و آنگاه‌] در صور دمیده شود و آنان را چنانکه باید گرد آوریم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و در آن روز (که جهان پایان می‌گیرد)، ما آنان را چنان رها می‌کنیم که درهم موج می‌زنند؛ و در صور [= شیپور] دمیده می‌شود؛ و ما همه را جمع می‌کنیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و گذاردیم گروهی از ایشان را در آن روز موج زنند در گروهی و دمیده شد در صور پس گردشان آوردیم گردآوردنی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و در آن روز واگذاريم كه در هم آميزند، و در صور دميده شود پس همه آنها را فراهم آوريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و (در آن روز) آنان را رها کنیم، تا موج‌آسا بعضی با بعضی دیگر درآمیزند، و در صور [:بوق جان‌افزا] دمیده شود. پس همه‌ی آنها را گرد (هم) آوریم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We shall leave them on that day surging like waves pressing one against the other, and the trumpet blast will be sounded, when We shall gather them all together.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And on that day We shall release them in groups surging like waves one after another, and the Trumpet will be blown – so We shall gather them all together. (* Gog and Magog will come out during the time of Eisa (Jesus – when he comes back to earth) and cause great destruction in the land.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Upon that day We shall leave them surging on one another, and the Trumpet shall he blown, and We shall gather them together,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We shall leave them on that day surging one against anot her and the trumpet shall be blown, and then We shall assemble them together.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And on that Day [i.e. the Day Ya'juj and Ma'juj (Gog and Magog) will come out], We shall leave them to surge like waves on one another, and the Trumpet will be blown, and We shall collect them all together.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On that Day, We will leave them surging upon one another. And the Trumpet will be blown, and We will gather them together.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And on that Day We shall let some of them surge like waves against others, and the Trumpet shall be blown. Then We shall gather them all together.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And on that Day, We shall leave some of them to surge like waves on one another; and the Trumpet will be blown, and We shall collect them (the creatures) all together.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And on that day we shall let some of them surge against others, and the Trumpet will be blown. Then We shall gather them together in one gathering.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: That day We shall let them surge over one another, the Trumpet will be blown, and We shall gather them all,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On that day, We will let them surge on one another, and the Horn shall be blown, and We will gather them all together.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On the day when the barrier is demolished, We will leave human beings in chaos. We will leave them like the waves of the sea striking against each other. Then the trumpet will be sounded and We will bring them all together.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And on that day We will leave a part of them in conflict with another part, and the trumpet will be blown, so We will gather them all together;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Watarakna baAAdahum yawmaithin yamooju fee baAAdin wanufikha fee alssoori fajamaAAnahum jamAAan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On that Day, We shall let them surge against each other like waves and then the Trumpet will be blown and We shall gather them all together.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: On that day We shall leave them to surge like waves on one another: the trumpet will be blown, and We shall collect them all together.

verses.text: وَ عَرَضْنَا جَهَنَّمَ‌ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْکَافِرِينَ‌ عَرْضاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و دوزخ را در آن روز [به صورتی بسیار ترسناک] برای کافران آشکار می کنیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و در آن روز جهنم را به كافران، چنان كه بايد، نشان خواهيم داد:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و آن روز جهنم را چنان كه بايد بر كافران عرضه مى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آن روز، جهنم را آشكارا به كافران بنماييم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و در آن روز دوزخ را (که انکار می‌کردند) آشکار به کافران بنماییم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و در آن روز، دوزخ را به طرز شگفتی به کافران نشان می‌دهیم (و ایشان را در آن گرد می‌آوریم). [[«عَرْضاً»: عرضه کردن عجیب و وحشتناکی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و در آن روز جهنم را بر کافران چنانکه باید و شاید بنمایانیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در آن روز، جهنم را بر کافران عرضه می‌داریم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و عرض کردیم دوزخ را آن روز بر کافران عرض‌کردنی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و در آن روز دوزخ را آشكارا به كافران بنماييم

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و آن روز، جهنم را آشکارا به کافران بنمایانیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then We shall bring Hell right before the infidels

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And We shall bring hell in front of the disbelievers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and upon that day We shall present Gehenna to the unbelievers

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And We shall set hell on that Day unto the infidels with a setting.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And on that Day We shall present Hell to the disbelievers, plain to view,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On that Day, We will present the disbelievers to Hell, all displayed.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: That will be the Day We shall place Hell before the unbelievers

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And on that Day We shall present Hell to the disbelievers, plain to view.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: On that day we shall present hell to the disbelievers, plain to view,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and on that day We shall bring hell into view visibly for the faithless.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On that Day We shall present Gehenna (Hell) to the unbelievers,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We will fully expose the view of hell on that Day to the disbelievers,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And We will bring forth hell, exposed to view, on that day before the unbelievers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: WaAAaradna jahannama yawmaithin lilkafireena AAardan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On that Day We shall lay Hell bare before those who deny the truth,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And We shall present Hell that day for Unbelievers to see, all spread out,-

verses.text: الَّذِينَ‌ کَانَتْ‌ أَعْيُنُهُمْ‌ فِي‌ غِطَاءٍ عَنْ‌ ذِکْرِي‌ وَ کَانُوا لاَ يَسْتَطِيعُونَ‌ سَمْعاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: همان کسانی که دیده [بصیرت] شان از یاد من در پرده [غفلت] بود، و نمی توانستند [سخن خدا را] بشنوند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آن كسان كه ديدگانشان از ياد من در حجاب بوده و توان شنيدن نداشته‌اند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همان كسانى كه چشمانشان از ياد من در پرده بود و توانايى شنيدن [حق را] نداشتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [به‌] همان كسانى كه چشمان [بصيرت‌]شان از ياد من در پرده بود، و توانايى شنيدن [حق‌] نداشتند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آن کافرانی که بر چشم (قلب) شان پرده (غفلت) بود و از یاد من غافل بودند و (از فرط هوای نفس) هیچ توانایی بر شنیدن (آیات و کلمه الهی) نداشتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: کافرانی که چشمانشان از (دیدن) آیات (خواندنی و دیدنی) من در پرده بوده و توان شنیدن (فرمان یزدان) را نداشته‌اند (و از نیروی بینائی و شنوائی برای درک حقائق و رسیدن به سعادت استفاده نکرده‌اند). [[«ذِکْر»: آیات کتابهای یزدان، و نشانه‌های خداشناسی موجود در کتاب معرفت جهان (نگا: یوسف / 105، طه / 124، انبیاء / 32).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: همان کسانی که دیدگانشان در پرده [غفلت‌] از آیات من بود، و نمی‌توانستند [حق را] بشنوند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: همانها که پرده‌ای چشمانشان را از یاد من پوشانده بود، و قدرت شنوایی نداشتند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آنان که بود دیدگانشان در پرده از یاد من و بودند نمی‌توانستند شنیدن را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنان كه ديدگانشان از ياد من در پوشش بود و شنيدن نمى‌توانستند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (به) همانان که چشمان (بصیرت)شان از یاد من غرق در پرده‌ای (ضخیم) بود، و هرگز توان شنیدن (حق) را نداشتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Whose eyes were veiled against My warning, and they could not hear.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The ones whose eyes were covered from My remembrance, and who could not bear to hear Truth.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: whose eyes were covered against My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Unto those whose eyes had been under a covering from My remembrance, nor had they been able to hear.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (To) Those whose eyes had been under a covering from My Reminder (this Quran), and who could not bear to hear (it).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those whose eyes were screened to My message, and were unable to hear.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: whose eyes had become blind against My admonition and who were utterly disinclined to hear it.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (To) those whose eyes had been under a covering from My Reminder, and they could not bear to hear (it).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Those whose eyes were hoodwinked from My reminder, and who could not bear to hear.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —Those whose eyes were blind to My remembrance and who could not hear.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: whose eyes were blinded to My remembrance and they were not able to hear.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed] from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: whose eyes had been veiled against Our Quran and who were not able to hear (its recitation).

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They whose eyes were under a cover from My reminder and they could not even hear.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Allatheena kanat aAAyunuhum fee ghitain AAan thikree wakanoo la yastateeAAoona samAAan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: who have turned a blind eye to My reminder and a deaf ear to My warning.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Unbelievers) whose eyes had been under a veil from remembrance of Me, and who had been unable even to hear.

verses.text: أَ فَحَسِبَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا أَنْ‌ يَتَّخِذُوا عِبَادِي‌ مِنْ‌ دُونِي‌ أَوْلِيَاءَ إِنَّا أَعْتَدْنَا جَهَنَّمَ‌ لِلْکَافِرِينَ‌ نُزُلاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا کسانی که کافرند، پنداشته اند که بندگانم را، به جای من سرپرستان خود می گیرند [برای آنان در دنیا و آخرت کاری انجام می دهند؟! چنین نیست قطعاً] ما دوزخ را برای پذیرایی کافران آماده کرده ایم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا كافران پندارند كه به جاى من بندگان مرا به خدايى گيرند؟ ما جهنم را آماده ساخته‌ايم تا منزلگاه كافران باشد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا كسانى كه كافر شدند پنداشته‌اند كه مى‌توانند به جاى من بندگانم را سرپرست بگيرند؟ ما جهنم را براى پذيرايى كافران آماده كرده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا كسانى كه كفر ورزيده‌اند، پنداشته‌اند كه [مى‌توانند] به جاى من، بندگانم را سرپرست بگيرند؟ ما جهنم را آماده كرده‌ايم تا جايگاه پذيرايى كافران باشد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا کافران پندارند که بندگان من (چون فرشتگان و حضرت مسیح) را به جای من دوست و یاور خود می‌گیرند؟! ما برای کافران دوزخ را منزلگاه قرار داده‌ایم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا کافران گمان می‌برند که بجز من، بندگان مرا (نیز اگر) سَرور و سرپرست خود گیرند (و معبود و مسجود خویش دانند، بدیشان سود می‌رسانند؟). ما دوزخ را برای پذیرائی از کافران آماده کرده‌ایم. [[«أَ»: آیا؟ جواب استفهام محذوف است و تقدیر چنین است: أَفَحَسِبَ الَّذِینَ کَفَرُوا ... أَنَّ ذلِکَ نَافِعٌ لَّهُمْ وَ صَارِفٌ عَنْهُمُ الْعَذابَ؟ «نُزُلاً»: آنچه به هنگام ورود مهمان با آن از مهمان پذیرائی کنند. محل پذیرائی (نگا: آل‌عمران / 198).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا کافران پنداشته‌اند که بندگان مرا [به ناحق‌] به جای من به دوستی بگیرند، [باید بدانند که‌] ما جهنم را چون منزلگاهی برای کافران آماده کرده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا کافران پنداشتند می‌توانند بندگانم را به جای من اولیای خود انتخاب کنند؟! ما جهنم را برای پذیرایی کافران آماده کرده‌ایم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا پنداشتند آنان که کفر ورزیدند که برگیرند بندگانم را جز من دوستانی همانا آماده کردیم دوزخ را برای کافران پیشکشی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا كسانى كه كافر شدند پنداشته‌اند كه بندگان مرا به جاى من دوست و كارساز مى‌گيرند؟! همانا ما دوزخ را براى كافران جايگاه- يا وسيله- پذيرايى ساخته‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا پس کسانی که کفر ورزیدند، پنداشتند که به جای من، بندگانم را سرپرست برگیرند؟ ما بی‌گمان جهنم را برای کافران آماده کرده‌ایم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do the unbelievers think they can make My own creatures their protectors against Me? We have prepared Hell for the hospitality of infidels.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Do the disbelievers assume that they will be able to choose My bondmen as supporters other than Me? Indeed We have prepared hell to welcome the disbelievers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, do the unbelievers reckon that they may take My servants as friends, apart from Me? We have prepared Gehenna for the unbelievers' hospitality.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Deem then those who disbelieve that they may take My bondmen, instead of Me, as patrons! Verily We have gotten ready the Hell for the infidels as an entertainment.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Do then those who disbelieve think that they can take My slaves [i.e., the angels, Allah's Messengers, 'Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary), etc.] as Auliya' (lords, gods, protectors, etc.) besides Me? Verily, We have prepared Hell as an entertainment for the disbelievers (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants for masters instead of Me? We have prepared Hell for the hospitality of the faithless.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do the unbelievers, then, believe that they can take any of My creatures as their guardians beside Me? Verily We have prepared Hell to welcome the unbelievers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Do then those who disbelieved think that they can take My servants as Awliya' [protectors] besides Me Verily, We have prepared Hell as an entertainment for the disbelievers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Do the disbelievers reckon that they can choose My bondmen as protecting friends beside Me? Lo! We have prepared hell as a welcome for the disbelievers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do the faithless suppose that they have taken My servants for guardians in My stead? Indeed, We have prepared hell for the hospitality of the faithless.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do the unbelievers think that they can take My worshipers as guides other than Me? We have prepared Gehenna to be the hospitality of the unbelievers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do the unbelievers think they can make My servants as their guardians instead of Me? We have prepared hell as a dwelling place for the disbelievers.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What! do then those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants to be guardians besides Me? Surely We have prepared hell for the entertainment of the unbelievers.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Afahasiba allatheena kafaroo an yattakhithoo AAibadee min doonee awliyaa inna aAAtadna jahannama lilkafireena nuzulan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do those who deny the truth, think that they can make My servants patrons instead of Me? We have reserved Hell as a lodging for those who deny the truth.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Do the Unbelievers think that they can take My servants as protectors besides Me? Verily We have prepared Hell for the Unbelievers for (their) entertainment.

verses.text: قُلْ‌ هَلْ‌ نُنَبِّئُکُمْ‌ بِالْأَخْسَرِينَ‌ أَعْمَالاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: آیا شما را از زیانکارترین مردم از جهت عمل آگاه کنم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: آيا شما را آگاه كنيم كه كردار چه كسانى بيش از همه به زيانشان بود؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: آيا شما را از آنها كه در كردار زيانكارترند آگاه سازيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «آيا شما را از زيانكارترين مردم آگاه گردانم؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو که آیا می‌خواهید شما را بر زیانکارترین مردم آگاه سازیم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای پیغمبر! به کافران) بگو: آیا شما را از زیانکارترین مردم آگاه سازم؟ [[«الأَخْسَرِینَ»: (نگا: هود / 22).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو آیا از زیانکارترین انسانها آگاهتان کنیم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «آیا به شما خبر دهیم که زیانکارترین (مردم) در کارها، چه کسانی هستند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو آیا آگهیتان دهم به زیانکارتران در کردار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: آيا شما را به زيانكارترين [مردم‌] در كردار، آگاه كنيم؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «آیا شما را از زیانکارترین مردم آگاه گردانیم‌؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "Shall I tell you whose labour will be wasted?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Say (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), “Shall we inform you whose are the most failed works?”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'Shall We tell you who will be the greatest losers in their works?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: shall I declare unto you the greatest losers in respect of works?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "Shall We tell you the greatest losers in respect of (their) deeds?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “Shall We inform you of the greatest losers in their works?”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say, (O Muhammad): "Shall We tell you who will be the greatest losers in respect of their works?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "Shall We tell you the greatest losers in respect of (their) deeds"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: Shall We inform you who will be the greatest losers by their works?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘Shall we inform you who are the biggest losers in their works?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'Shall we tell you of those who are the greatest losers in deeds'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, [O Muhammad], "Shall we [believers] inform you of the greatest losers as to [their] deeds?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), tell them, "Should I tell you who will face the greatest loss as a result of their deeds?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: Shall We inform you of the greatest losers in (their) deeds?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul hal nunabbiokum bialakhsareena aAAmalan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "Shall I tell you of those who will lose the most through their actions?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "Shall we tell you of those who lose most in respect of their deeds?-

verses.text: الَّذِينَ‌ ضَلَ‌ سَعْيُهُمْ‌ فِي‌ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا وَ هُمْ‌ يَحْسَبُونَ‌ أَنَّهُمْ‌ يُحْسِنُونَ‌ صُنْعاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [آنان] کسانی هستند که کوششان در زندگی دنیا به هدر رفته [و گم شده است] در حالی که خود می پندارند، خوب عمل می کنند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنهايى كه كوششان در زندگى دنيا تباه شد و مى‌پنداشتند كارى نيكو مى‌كنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كسانى هستند كه سعيشان در زندگى دنيا هدر رفته و با اين حال مى‌پندارند كه كار نيك انجام مى‌دهند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [آنان‌] كسانى‌اند كه كوشش‌شان در زندگى دنيا به هدر رفته و خود مى‌پندارند كه كار خوب انجام مى‌دهند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (زیانکارترین مردم) آنها هستند که (عمر و) سعی‌شان در راه دنیای فانی تباه گردید و به خیال باطل می‌پنداشتند که نیکوکاری می‌کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان کسانیند که تلاش و تکاپویشان (به سبب تباهی عقیده و باورشان) در زندگی دنیا هدر می‌رود (و بیسود می‌شود) و خود گمان می‌برند که به بهترین وجه کار نیک می‌کنند (و طاعت و عبادت شرک‌آلودشان موجب رستگاریشان می‌شود). [[«ضَلَّ»: ضائع گردید و هدر رفت. از مصدر ضَلال به معنی ضَیاع. «صُنْعاً»: کار نیکوئی که به گونه شایسته و با نظم و ترتیب بایسته انجام می‌پذیرد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: کسانی‌[اند] که کوشش آنان در راه زندگانی دنیا، نقش بر آب شده است و ایشان چنین می‌انگارند که نیکو کردارند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها که تلاشهایشان در زندگی دنیا گم (و نابود) شده؛ با این حال، می‌پندارند کار نیک انجام می‌دهند!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آنان که تباه شده است کوشش ایشان در زندگانی دنیا و می‌پندارند که ایشان نکو می‌کنند عمل را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنهايند كه كوشش آنان در زندگى اين جهان گم و تباه شده و خود مى‌پندارند كه كار نيكو مى‌كنند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: کسانی که کوشش‌شان در (ژرفای) زندگی دنیا گم گشته، حال آنکه می‌پندارند کاری خوب انجام می‌دهند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Theirs whose effort is misspent in pursuit of the pleasures of the world, even though they think they are doing good things."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Of those whose efforts are lost in (pursuit of) the life of this world, and they think that they are doing good deeds.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Those whose striving goes astray in the present life, while they think that they are working good deeds.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They are those whose effort is wasted in the life of the world, and they deem that they are doing well in performance.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life while they thought that they were acquiring good by their deeds!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Those whose efforts in this world are misguided, while they assume that they are doing well.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: It will be those whose effort went astray in the life of the world and who believe nevertheless that they are doing good.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life while they thought that they were acquiring good by their deeds."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Those whose effort goeth astray in the life of the world, and yet they reckon that they do good work.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Those whose efforts are misguided in the life of the world, while they suppose they are doing good.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (They are) those whose striving in this world go astray, while they think that what they are doing are good deeds.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [They are] those whose effort is lost in worldly life, while they think that they are doing well in work."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It will be those who labor a great deal in this life but without guidance, yet think that they are doing a great many good deeds.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: (These are) they whose labor is lost in this world's life and they think that they are well versed in skill of the work of hands.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Allatheena dalla saAAyuhum fee alhayati alddunya wahum yahsaboona annahum yuhsinoona sunAAan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They are those whose efforts have been wasted in the life of the world while they thought they were doing good.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life, while they thought that they were acquiring good by their works?"

verses.text: أُولٰئِکَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِ‌ رَبِّهِمْ‌ وَ لِقَائِهِ‌ فَحَبِطَتْ‌ أَعْمَالُهُمْ‌ فَلاَ نُقِيمُ‌ لَهُمْ‌ يَوْمَ‌ الْقِيَامَةِ وَزْناً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آنان کسانی هستند که آیات پروردگارشان و دیدار [قیامت و محاسبه اعمال] را به وسیله او منکر شدند، در نتیجه اعمالشان تباه و بی اثر شده است، پس روز قیامت میزانی برای [محاسبه اعمال] آنان برپا نمی کنیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنان به آيات پروردگارشان و به ملاقات با او ايمان نياوردند، پس اعمالشان ناچيز شد و ما در روز قيامت برايشان منزلتى قائل نيستيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آنان كسانى‌اند كه آيات پروردگارشان و لقاى او را انكار كردند، در نتيجه اعمالشان تباه گرديد و روز قيامت براى آنها ميزانى برپا نمى‌كنيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [آرى،] آنان كسانى‌اند كه آيات پروردگارشان و لقاى او را انكار كردند، در نتيجه اعمالشان تباه گرديد، و روز قيامت براى آنها [قدر و] ارزشى نخواهيم نهاد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همین دنیا طلبانند که به آیات خدای خود کافر شدند و (روز) ملاقات خدا را انکار کردند، لذا اعمالشان همه تباه گشته و روز قیامت آنها را هیچ وزن و ارزشی نخواهیم داد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان کسانیند که به آیات (قرآنی و دلائل قدرت) پروردگارشان و ملاقات او (در جهان دیگر، برای حساب و کتاب) بی‌باور و کافرند، و در نتیجه اعمالشان باطل و هدر می‌رود، و در روز رستاخیز ارزشی برای ایشان قائل نمی‌شویم (و قدر و منزلتی در پیشگاه ما نخواهند داشت). [[«وَزْناً»: مکانت و منزلت. قدر و قیمت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اینان کسانی هستند که آیات پروردگارشان و لقای او را انکار کرده‌اند، و اعمالشان تباه شده، لذا روز قیامت وزنی برای آنان قائل نیستیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها کسانی هستند که به آیات پروردگارشان و لقای او کافر شدند؛ به همین جهت، اعمالشان حبط و نابود شد! از این رو روز قیامت، میزانی برای آنها برپا نخواهیم کرد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آنانند که کفر ورزیدند به آیتهای پروردگار خویش و ملاقات او پس تباه شد اعمال ایشان پس بپای نداریم برای آنان روز قیامت وزنی (ترازوئی) را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آنانند كه به آيات پروردگارشان و ديدار او كافر شدند، پس كارهاشان تباه و نابود شد و از اين‌رو در روز رستاخيز براى آنها هيچ ترازويى ننهيم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ایشان کسانی‌اند که آیات پروردگارشان و لقای او را انکار کردند؛ در نتیجه اعمالشان تباه گردید. پس روز قیامت برایشان هیچ وزنی (:میزانی) به پا نخواهیم داشت.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They are those who reject the signs of their Lord, and the meeting with Him. So their good deeds will be fruitless, and on the Day of Judgement We shall not appoint any weighing for them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The people who disbelieved in the signs of their Lord and in the meeting with Him, therefore all their deeds are in vain –We shall therefore not establish any weighing for them on the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Those are they that disbelieve in the signs of their Lord and the encounter with Him; their works have failed, and on the Day of Resurrection We shall not assign to them any weight.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They are those who disbelieve in the signs of their Lord and in the meeting with Him; so of non-effect will be made their works, and We shall not allow them on the Day of Judgment any weight.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "They are those who deny the Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of their Lord and the Meeting with Him (in the Hereafter). So their works are in vain, and on the Day of Resurrection, We shall not give them any weight.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: It is they who rejected the communications of their Lord, and the encounter with Him. So their works are in vain. And on the Day of Resurrection, We will consider them of no weight.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Those are the ones who refused to believe in the revelations of their Lord and that they are bound to meet Him. Hence, all their deeds have come to naught, and We shall assign no weight to them on the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "They are those who deny the Ayat of their Lord and the meeting with Him. So their works are in vain, and on the Day of Resurrection, We shall assign no weight for them."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Those are they who disbelieve in the revelations of their Lord and in the meeting with Him. Therefor their works are vain, and on the Day of Resurrection We assign no weight to them.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They are the ones who deny the signs of their Lord and encounter with Him. So their works have failed. On the Day of Resurrection We will not give them any weight.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Those are they who disbelieve the verses of their Lord and deny that they will ever meet Him their deeds have failed. On the Day of Resurrection, We shall not give any weight to them.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord and in [their] meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any importance.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They have rejected the revelations of their Lord and their meeting with Him. Thus, their deeds will be made devoid of all virtue and will be of no value on the Day of Judgment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: These are they who disbelieve in the communications of their Lord and His meeting, so their deeds become null, and therefore We will not set up a balance for them on the day of resurrection.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Olaika allatheena kafaroo biayati rabbihim waliqaihi fahabitat aAAmaluhum fala nuqeemu lahum yawma alqiyamati waznan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They are those who deny their Lord's signs and the meeting with Him." So their works are in vain, and We shall give them no weight on the Day of Resurrection.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They are those who deny the Signs of their Lord and the fact of their having to meet Him (in the Hereafter): vain will be their works, nor shall We, on the Day of Judgment, give them any weight.

verses.text: ذٰلِکَ‌ جَزَاؤُهُمْ‌ جَهَنَّمُ‌ بِمَا کَفَرُوا وَ اتَّخَذُوا آيَاتِي‌ وَ رُسُلِي‌ هُزُواً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: این است [وضع و حال زیانکاران] به سبب آنکه کفر ورزیدند و آیات من و پیامبرانم را به مسخره گرفتند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: همچنين كيفر آنان به سبب كفرشان و نيز بدان سبب كه آيات و پيامبران مرا مسخره مى‌كردند، جهنم است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اين است سزايشان كه همان جهنم است، چرا كه كافر شدند و آيات من و پيامبرانم را به ريشخند گرفتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اين جهنم سزاى آنان است، چرا كه كافر شدند و آيات من و پيامبرانم را به ريشخند گرفتند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این است که اینان چون کافر شده و آیات و پیمبران مرا استهزاء کردند به آتش دوزخ کیفر خواهند یافت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (حال و احوال ایشان) همان گونه است (که بیان کردیم)، و به سبب کفر ورزیدنشان و به خاطر مسخره کردن آیاتم و پیغمبرانم توسّط ایشان، سزای آنان دوزخ است. [[«ذلِکَ جَزَآؤُهُمْ جَهَنَّمُ»: این سزای ایشان است که دوزخ است. آنچه بیان شد، حال و وضع ایشان است و دوزخ پادافره آنان است. واژه (ذلِکَ) می‌تواند مبتدا و (جَزَآءُ) خبر و (جَهَنَّمُ) بدل باشد؛ و یا این که (ذلِکَ) خبر مبتدای محذوف و (جَزَآءُ) مبتدا و (جَهَنَّمُ) خبر باشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: این چنین است که به خاطر کفری که ورزیده‌اند و آیات و پیامبران مرا به ریشخند گرفته‌اند، جزای آنان جهنم است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آری،) این گونه است! کیفرشان دوزخ است، بخاطر آنکه کافر شدند، و آیات من و پیامبرانم را به سخریه گرفتند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: این است پاداش ایشان دوزخ بدانچه کفر ورزیدند و برگرفتند آیتهای مرا و پیمبران مرا ریشخند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اين است كه پاداش آنان دوزخ است به سزاى آنكه كفر ورزيدند و آيات و فرستادگان مرا به ريشخند گرفتند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: این (جهنم) سزای آنان است، در پیامد (اینکه) کافر شدند، و آیات من و پیامبرانم را به مسخره گرفتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Their requital will be Hell, because they disbelieved and mocked My signs and messengers.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: This is their reward – hell – because they disbelieved, and made a mockery of My verses and My Noble Messengers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: That is their recompense -- Gehenna for that they were unbelievers and took My signs and My messengers in mockery.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: That shall be their meed--Hell-for they disbelieved and held My revelations and My apostles in mockery.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "That shall be their recompense, Hell; because they disbelieved and took My Ayat (proofs, evidences, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) and My Messengers by way of jest and mockery.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: That is their requital—Hell—on account of their disbelief, and their taking My revelations and My messengers in mockery.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Hell is their recompense for disbelieving and their taking My revelations and My Messengers as objects of jest.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "That shall be their recompense, Hell; because they disbelieved and took My Ayat and My Messengers for jest."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: That is their reward: hell, because they disbelieved, and made a jest of Our revelations and Our messengers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: That is their requital—hell—because of their unfaith and for deriding My signs and apostles.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Gehenna is their recompense; because they disbelieved and mocked My verses, and My Messengers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and [because] they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: For their disbelief and their mocking Our revelations and Messengerss, their recompense will be hell.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Thus it is that their recompense is hell, because they disbelieved and held My communications and My apostles in mockery.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thalika jazaohum jahannamu bima kafaroo waittakhathoo ayatee warusulee huzuwan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Hell will be their reward, because they denied the truth, and made a jest of My signs and My messengers.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: That is their reward, Hell, because they rejected Faith, and took My Signs and My Messengers by way of jest.

verses.text: إِنَ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ آمَنُوا وَ عَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ‌ کَانَتْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ جَنَّاتُ‌ الْفِرْدَوْسِ‌ نُزُلاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: مسلماً کسانی که ایمان آورده و کارهای شایسته انجام داده اند، بهشت های فردوس جای پذیرایی آنان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كسانى كه ايمان آوردند و كارهاى شايسته كردند مهمانسرايشان باغهاى فردوس است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بى‌گمان كسانى كه ايمان آورده و كارهاى شايسته كردند باغ‌هاى فردوس جاى پذيرايى آنهاست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بى‌گمان كسانى كه ايمان آورده و كارهاى شايسته كرده‌اند، باغهاى فردوس جايگاه پذيرايى آنان است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنان که به خدا ایمان آورده و نیکوکار شدند البته آنها در بهشت فردوس منزل خواهند یافت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بی‌گمان کسانی که ایمان آورده‌اند و کارهای شایسته کرده‌اند، باغهای بهشت جایگاه پذیرائی از ایشان است. [[«الْفِرْدَوْسِ»: بهشتِ برین. بهشت (نگا: مؤمنون / 11). «نُزُلاً»: خبر (کانَتْ) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان منزلگاه کسانی که ایمان آورده‌اند و کارهای شایسته کرده‌اند، باغهای فردوس است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا کسانی که ایمان آوردند و کارهای شایسته انجام دادند، باغهای بهشت برین محل پذیرایی آنان خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا آنان که ایمان آوردند و کردار شایسته کردند بوده است ایشان را باغهای بهشت پیشکشی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا كسانى كه ايمان آوردند و كارهاى نيك و شايسته كردند بهشتهاى فردوس جايگاه- يا وسيله- پذيرايى ايشان است

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌گمان کسانی که ایمان آورده و کارهای شایسته‌(ی ایمان) کردند، باغ‌های سردرهم فردوس جایگاه پذیرایی آنان بوده است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But surely those who believe and do the right will have gardens of Paradise as gift,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed those who believed and did good deeds – their welcome are the Gardens of Paradise.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- the Gardens. of Paradise shall be their hospitality,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily those who believe and do righteous works, unto them shall be gardens of Paradise for an entertainment.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Verily! Those who believe (in the Oneness of Allah Islamic Monotheism) and do righteous deeds, shall have the Gardens of Al-Firdaus (the Paradise) for their entertainment.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, they will have the Gardens of Paradise for hospitality.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: As for those who believe and do good works, the Gardens of Paradise shall be there to welcome them;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Verily, those who believe and do righteous deeds, shall have the Gardens of Al-Firdaws for their entertainment."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! those who believe and do good works, theirs are the Gardens of Paradise for welcome,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: As for those who have faith and do righteous deeds, they shall have the gardens of Firdaws for abode,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: The hospitality of those who believe and do good works shall be the Gardens of Paradise

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The righteously striving believers will have the gardens of Paradise as their dwelling place and therein they will live forever,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely (as for) those who believe and do good deeds, their place of entertainment shall be the gardens of paradise,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna allatheena amanoo waAAamiloo alssalihati kanat lahum jannatu alfirdawsi nuzulan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Those who believe and do good works shall have the gardens of Paradise for their abode.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: As to those who believe and work righteous deeds, they have, for their entertainment, the Gardens of Paradise,

verses.text: خَالِدِينَ‌ فِيهَا لاَ يَبْغُونَ‌ عَنْهَا حِوَلاً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در آن جاودانه اند و از آن درخواست انتقال به جای دیگر نمی کنند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در آنجا جاويدانند و هرگز هواى انتقال نكنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: در آن جاودانه باشند و از آن جا انتقال نطلبند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: جاودانه در آن خواهند بود، و از آنجا درخواست انتقال نمى‌كنند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همیشه در آن بهشت ابد منزل یافته و هرگز از آنجا انتقال نخواهند یافت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: جاودانه در آنجا می‌مانند و تقاضای نقل مکان از آنجا را نمی‌نمایند (و حاضر نیستند آن را با چیزی عوض کنند). [[«خَالِدِینَ»: حال است. «لا یَبْغُونَ»: نمی‌خواهند. خواستار نمی‌شوند. «حِوَلاً»: تعویض و تحوّل. جابه‌جائی و دگرگونی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که جاودانه در آنند [و] از آنجا گرایش به هیچ جا ندارند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها جاودانه در آن خواهند ماند؛ و هرگز تقاضای نقل مکان از آن جا نمی‌کنند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: جاودانند در آن نجویند از آن جابجاشدن را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در آنجا جاودانه‌اند و دگرگونى از آن نخواهند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: جاودانه در آن خواهند بود (و) از آنجا درخواست انتقال و تحولی (به جایی دیگر) نکنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Where they will abide for ever, never wanting a change.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They will abide in it for ever, never wanting to shift from it.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: therein to dwell forever, desiring no removal out of them.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: As abiders therein, they shall not seek therefrom any change.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Wherein they shall dwell (forever). No desire will they have to be removed therefrom."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Abiding therein forever, without desiring any change therefrom.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: there they will abide for ever, with no desire to be removed from there."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Wherein they shall dwell (forever). No desire will they have for removal therefrom."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Wherein they will abide, with no desire to be removed from thence.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: to remain in them [forever]; they will not seek to leave it for another place.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: where they will live for ever and never wish that they should be removed from it.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: without any desire to change their abode.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Abiding therein; they shall not desire removal from them.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Khalideena feeha la yabghoona AAanha hiwalan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They shall forever dwell in the Gardens of Paradise, desiring no change.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Wherein they shall dwell (for aye): no change will they wish for from them.

verses.text: قُلْ‌ لَوْ کَانَ‌ الْبَحْرُ مِدَاداً لِکَلِمَاتِ‌ رَبِّي‌ لَنَفِدَ الْبَحْرُ قَبْلَ‌ أَنْ‌ تَنْفَدَ کَلِمَاتُ‌ رَبِّي‌ وَ لَوْ جِئْنَا بِمِثْلِهِ‌ مَدَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: اگر دریا برای [نوشتن] کلمات پروردگارم [که مخلوقات او هستند] مرکب شود، پیش از آنکه کلمات پروردگارم پایان یابد، یقیناً دریا پایان می یابد، و اگرچه مانند آن دریا را به کمک بیاوریم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: اگر دريا براى نوشتن كلمات پروردگار من مركب شود، دريا به پايان مى‌رسد و كلمات پروردگار من به پايان نمى‌رسد، هر چند درياى ديگرى به مدد آن بياوريم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: اگر دريا براى [ثبت‌] كلمات پروردگارم مركّب مى‌گشت، بى‌شك دريا تمام مى‌شد پيش از آن كه كلمات پروردگارم تمام شود، هر چند درياى ديگرى نيز كمك بياوريم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «اگر دريا براى كلمات پروردگارم مركب شود، پيش از آنكه كلمات پروردگارم پايان پذيرد، قطعاً دريا پايان مى‌يابد، هر چند نظيرش را به مدد [آن‌] بياوريم.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو که اگر دریا برای (نوشتن) کلمات پروردگار من مرکب شود پیش از آنکه کلمات پروردگارم به آخر رسد دریا خشک خواهد شد هر چند دریایی دیگر باز ضمیمه آن کنیم (یعنی عوالم وجود که کلمات تکوینی الهی است بی‌حد و نامتناهی است).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بگو: اگر دریا برای (نگارش شماره و صفات و ویژگیهای) موجودات (جهان هستی) پروردگارم جوهر شود، دریا پایان می‌گیرد پیش از آن که (سخن از تعداد و حقائق و رموز) موجودات پروردگارم پایان پذیرد، هرچند هم همسان آن دریا را به عنوان کمک بدان بیفزائیم (و مرکّب و جوهرش نمائیم). [[«مِدَاداً»: مرکّب. جوهر. «کَلِمَاتِ»: سخنان. مراد موجودات و مخلوقات جهان هستی است (نگا: نساء / 171). «نَفِدَ»: پایان پذیرفت. تمام شد. «مَدَداً»: یاری. مددکاری. تمییز است. مرادِ آیه، ترسیمی از بی‌نهایت و بیان کثرت است (نگا: لقمان / 27).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو اگر دریا برای [نوشتن‌] کلمات پروردگارم مرکب باشد، بی‌شک آن دریا، پیش از به پایان رسیدن کلمات پروردگارم، به پایان می‌رسد، ولو آنکه مددی همانند آن به میان آوریم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «اگر دریاها برای (نوشتن) کلمات پروردگارم مرکّب شود، دریاها پایان می‌گیرد. پیش از آنکه کلمات پروردگارم پایان یابد؛ هر چند همانند آن (دریاها) را کمک آن قرار دهیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو اگر می‌شد دریا مدادی برای سخنان پروردگارم همانا پایان می‌یافت دریا پیش از آنکه پایان یابند سخنان پروردگارم و هر چند بیاریم همانند آن کمک را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: اگر دريا براى [نوشتن‌] كلمات- آفريده‌هاى- پروردگار من مركب بود هر آينه دريا به پايان مى‌رسيد پيش از آنكه كلمات پروردگارم به پايان رسد هر چند مانند آن را به يارى بياريم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «اگر دریا برای نبشتن کلمات پروردگارم مرکّب بود، پیش از آنکه کلمات پروردگارم پایان پذیرد، بی‌گمان دریا پایان می‌یافت هر چند نظیرش را به مدد(ش) بیاوریم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "If the ocean turned to ink for writing down the colloquy of my Lord, the ocean itself would be exhausted ere the words (and wonders) of my Lord come to end, even if we brought another like it for replenishment."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Proclaim, “If the sea became ink for the Words of my Lord, the sea would indeed be used up and the Words of my Lord would never – even if we bring another like it for help.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say:. 'If the sea were ink for the Words of my Lord, the sea would be spent before the Words of my Lord are spent, though We brought replenishment the like of it.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: were the sea to become ink for the words of my Lord, the sea would surely exhaust ere the words of my Lord exhausted, even though We brought onot her like thereof for support.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW to mankind). "If the sea were ink for (writing) the Words of my Lord, surely, the sea would be exhausted before the Words of my Lord would be finished, even if we brought (another sea) like it for its aid."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “If the ocean were ink for the words of my Lord, the ocean would run out, before the words of my Lord run out,” even if We were to bring the like of it in addition to it.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say: "If the sea were to become ink to record the Words of my Lord, indeed the sea would be all used up before the Words of my Lord are exhausted, and it would be the same even if We were to bring an equal amount of ink."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "If the sea were ink for the Words of my Lord, surely, the sea would be exhausted before the Words of my Lord would be finished, even if We brought like it for its aid."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: Though the sea became ink for the Words of my Lord, verily the sea would be used up before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even though We brought the like thereof to help.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘If the sea were ink for the words of my Lord, the sea would be spent before the words of my Lord are finished, though We replenish it with another like it.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'If the sea were ink for the Words of my Lord, the sea would surely be spent before the Words of my Lord are spent, even if We brought its like for replenishment'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "If the sea were ink for [writing] the words of my Lord, the sea would be exhausted before the words of my Lord were exhausted, even if We brought the like of it as a supplement."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), tell them, "Had the seas been used as ink to write down the words of my Lord, they would have all been consumed before the words of my Lord could have been recorded, even though replenished with a like quantity of ink.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: If the sea were ink for the words of my Lord, the sea would surely be consumed before the words of my Lord are exhausted, though We were to bring the like of that (sea) to add

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul law kana albahru midadan likalimati rabbee lanafida albahru qabla an tanfada kalimatu rabbee walaw jina bimithlihi madadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Tell them, "If the ocean became ink for writing the words of my Lord, surely the ocean would be exhausted before the words of my Lord came to an end -- even if We were to add another ocean to it."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "If the ocean were ink (wherewith to write out) the words of my Lord, sooner would the ocean be exhausted than would the words of my Lord, even if we added another ocean like it, for its aid."

verses.text: قُلْ‌ إِنَّمَا أَنَا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُکُمْ‌ يُوحَى‌ إِلَيَ‌ أَنَّمَا إِلٰهُکُمْ‌ إِلٰهٌ‌ وَاحِدٌ فَمَنْ‌ کَانَ‌ يَرْجُو لِقَاءَ رَبِّهِ‌ فَلْيَعْمَلْ‌ عَمَلاً صَالِحاً وَ لاَ يُشْرِکْ‌ بِعِبَادَةِ رَبِّهِ‌ أَحَداً

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بگو: جز این نیست که من هم بشری مانند شمایم که به من وحی می شود که معبود شما فقط خدای یکتاست؛ پس کسی که دیدار [پاداش و مقام قرب] پروردگارش را امید دارد، پس باید کاری شایسته انجام دهد و هیچ کس را در پرستش پروردگارش شریک نکند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بگو: من انسانى هستم همانند شما. به من وحى مى‌شود. هرآينه خداى شما خدايى است يكتا. هر كس ديدار پروردگار خويش را اميد مى‌بندد، بايد كردارى شايسته داشته باشد و در پرستش پروردگارش هيچ كس را شريك نسازد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بگو: جز اين نيست كه من بشرى مثل شما هستم [با اين تفاوت‌] كه به من وحى مى‌شود كه خداى شما خدايى يگانه است. پس هر كس به لقاى پروردگارش اميد دارد بايد عمل شايسته كند و كسى را در عبادت پروردگارش شريك نسازد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بگو: «من هم مِثل شما بشرى هستم و[لى‌] به من وحى مى‌شود كه خداى شما خدايى يگانه است. پس هر كس به لقاى پروردگار خود اميد دارد بايد به كار شايسته بپردازد، و هيچ كس را در پرستش پروردگارش شريك نسازد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بگو: جز این نیست که من مانند شما بشری هستم (دعوی احاطه به جهان‌های نامتناهی و کلیه کلمات الهی نکنم، تنها فرق من با شما این است) که به من وحی می‌رسد که خدای شما خدای یکتاست، پس هر کس به لقای (رحمت) پروردگارش امیدوار است باید نیکوکار شود و هرگز در پرستش خدایش احدی را با او شریک نگرداند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (ای پیغمبر!) بگو: من فقط انسانی همچون شما هستم (و امتیاز من این است که من پیغمبر خدایم و آنچه گفت: بگو؛ می‌گویم) و به من وحی می‌شود که معبود شما یکی است و بس. پس هرکس که خواهان دیدار خدای خویش است، باید که کار شایسته کند، و در پرستش پروردگارش کسی را شریک نسازد. [[«أَنَّمَا إِلهُکُمْ إِلهٌ واحِدٌ»: نائب فاعل فعل (یُوحی) است. «یَرْجُو»: می‌خواهد. امیدوار است. الف زائدی در رسم‌الخطّ قرآنی در آخر دارد. «یَرْجُو لِقَآءَ رَبِّهِ»: می‌ترسد از حاضر شدن در پیشگاه او برای حساب و کتاب. خواهان دیدار و ملاقات او است. چشم به راه ثواب و جزای او است. «بِعِبَادَةِ»: در عبادت و پرستش. حرف (بِ) به معنی (فی) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بگو من بشری همانند شما هستم، با این تفاوت که به من وحی می‌شود که خدای شما خدای یگانه است، حال هر آن کس که امید در لقای پروردگارش بسته است، کار نیکو پیشه کند و در پرستش پروردگارش کسی را شریک نیاورد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بگو: «من فقط بشری هستم مثل شما؛ (امتیازم این است که) به من وحی می‌شود که تنها معبودتان معبود یگانه است؛ پس هر که به لقای پروردگارش امید دارد، باید کاری شایسته انجام دهد، و هیچ کس را در عبادت پروردگارش شریک نکند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بگو جز این نیست که من بشری هستم مانند شما وحی می‌شود به سویم که خدای شما است خداوند یکتا پس آنکه امید دارد ملاقات پروردگار خویش را باید بکند کرداری شایسته و شریک نگرداند به پرستش پروردگار خویش کسی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بگو: همانا من آدميى هستم همچون شما كه به من وحى مى‌شود كه خداى شما خداى يگانه است. پس هر كه اميد ديدار پروردگار خويش دارد بايد كار نيك و شايسته كند و هيچ كس را در پرستش پروردگارش شريك نسازد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بگو: «من تنها بشری همانند شمایم. (اما) به من وحی می‌شود که خدای شما خدایی یگانه است. پس هر کس به لقای پروردگار خود امید دارد، باید کاری شایسته کند و هیچ کس را، در پرستش پروردگارش (با او) شریک نسازد.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Say: "I am only a man like you, but it has been communicated to me that your Lord is one and single God, and that whosoever hopes to meet his Lord should do what is right, and not associate any one in the worship of his Lord."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Proclaim, “Physically I am a human* like you – my Lord sends divine revelations to me – that your God is only One God; so whoever expects to the meet his Lord must perform good deeds and not ascribe anyone as a partner in the worship of his Lord.” (* Human but not equal to you, in fact the greatest in spiritual status.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Say: 'I am only a mortal the like of you; it is revealed to me that your God is One God. So let him, who hopes for the encounter with his Lord, work righteousness, and not associate with his Lord's service anyone.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Say thou: I am but a human being like yourselves; revealed unto me is that your God is One God. Whosoever then hopeth for the meeting with his Lord, let him work righteous work, and let him not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "I am only a man like you. It has been inspired to me that your Ilah (God) is One Ilah (God i.e. Allah). So whoever hopes for the Meeting with his Lord, let him work righteousness and associate none as a partner in the worship of his Lord."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Say, “I am only a human being like you, being inspired that your god is One God. Whoever hopes to meet his Lord, let him work righteousness, and never associate anyone with the service of his Lord.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Say (O Muhammad): "I am no more than a human being like you; one to whom revelation is made: 'Your Lord is the One and Only God.' Hence, whoever looks forward to meet his Lord, let him do righteous works, and let him associate none with the worship of his Lord."

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Say: "I am only a man like you. It has been revealed to me that your God is One God. So whoever hopes for the meeting with his Lord, let him work righteousness and associate none as a partner in the worship of his Lord."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Say: I am only a mortal like you. My Lord inspireth in me that your Allah is only One Allah. And whoever hopeth for the meeting with his Lord, let him do righteous work, and make none sharer of the worship due unto his Lord.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Say, ‘I am just a human being like you. It has been revealed to me that your God is the One God. So whoever expects to encounter his Lord—let him act righteously, and not associate anyone with the worship of his Lord.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Say: 'I am only a human like you, revealed to me is that your God is One God. Let him who hopes for the encounter with his Lord do good work, and not associate anyone with the worship of his Lord'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Say, "I am only a man like you, to whom has been revealed that your god is one God. So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Say, "I am only a mortal like you but I have received revelation that there is only one Lord. Whoever desires to meet his Lord should strive righteously and should worship no one besides Him.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Say: I am only a mortal like you; it is revealed to me that your god is one Allah, therefore whoever hopes to meet his Lord, he should do good deeds, and not join any one in the service of his Lord.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qul innama ana basharun mithlukum yooha ilayya annama ilahukum ilahun wahidun faman kana yarjoo liqaa rabbihi falyaAAmal AAamalan salihan wala yushrik biAAibadati rabbihi ahadan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Say, "I am only a human being like yourselves. It is revealed to me that your God is One God. So let him who hopes to meet his Lord do good deeds and let him associate no one else in the worship of his Lord."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Say: "I am but a man like yourselves, (but) the inspiration has come to me, that your Allah is one Allah: whoever expects to meet his Lord, let him work righteousness, and, in the worship of his Lord, admit no one as partner.
